member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraCalc.UltraCalcReferenceException
member.summary: Exception signifying a failure to find a reference within UltraWebGrid by the UltraCalc engine.

remarks.p: This exception may be thrown when an UltraWebGrid object serves as an IUltraCalcReference, but exceptional conditions prohibit the UltraCalc engine from working with the UltraWebGrid object. A non-exhaustive list of possible conditions that could cause this exception to arise include changing the name (Key) of a grid object without making a corresponding change to referent Formula(s), sudden removal of a grid object with dependencies in the UltraCalc engine during re-calc processing (for instance, by way of a separate thread), or unexpected topological changes to the calculation network.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraCalc.GridReference.GetFirstValidTuple(Infragistics.WebUI.CalcEngine.RefParser,System.Collections.IEnumerator,Infragistics.WebUI.CalcEngine.UltraCalcReferenceError@)
member.summary: Gets the first valid tuple from the enumeration.
member.param: The from which to retrieve tuples (only used in event of an error needs to be produced).
An enumerator used to enumerate objects.
An UltraCalcReferenceError that is modified if an error has occurred.
member.returns: The next valid tuple enumerated, after passing several validations.

remarks.p: The validations this method performs include checking that there is a next tuple to be enumerated, verifying that the next tuple has an expected identifier name, and that the next tuple is within a defined scope (not the wildcard Any scope).

member.exception: Thrown if one of the objects in the enumeration furnished by tupleEnum is not of the expected type, RefTuple.

Thrown when the next tuple retrieved from tupleEnum violates one of the criteria that GetFirstValidTuple checks for. This exception may also be thrown if an attempt is made to enumerate the last tuple from an exhausted tupleEnum enumerator.

member.returns: A newly constructed IUltraCalcReference surrogate object.
member.exception: Thrown when the newRef argument is null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET). BuildReference requires a foundational newRef with which to construct new instances of RefBase.
Thrown when the RefTuple instances being enumerated include a non-RefTuple sibling.
Thrown when fails to enumerate the next available RefTuple instance, because there are no more valid tuples to enumerate.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ActivationObject
member.summary: The ActivationObject object specifies the properties that will be applied to an object in the grid to indicate that it is the active object. THe active object is the object that has input focus.

remarks.p: The ActivationObject controls the look and behavior of the rectangle that appears around individual rows and cells as they are selected with the mouse or keyboard on the client. The Activation object provides visual feedback to the user telling him or her which cell is currently active within the grid. The ActivationObject is created automatically by UltraWebGrid.

Using the ActivationObject, the color, width and style of the Activation rectangle can be set. If the grid is meant to be read-only, the Activation rectangle can be turned off completely using the AllowActivation property.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ActivationObject.#ctor
member.summary: The default constructor for the Activation object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ActivationObject.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of an object.

remarks.p: Some objects do not have values that can be converted to a string. In these cases, an empty string is returned.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ActivationObject.Reset
member.summary: Resets all properties of the class to their default values.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to reset all properties of the ActivationObject class to their default values.
The "ShouldSerialize" properties of the ActivationObject will return False until set again.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ActivationObject.CopyFrom(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ActivationObject)
member.summary: Copies the property settings of the specified ActivationObject object to the current ActivationObject object.

remarks.p: When you pass an ActivationObject object to this method, the AllowActivation, BorderColor, BorderStyle and BorderWidth of the passed-in object will be applied to the values of the current object.

member.param: An ActivationObject object whose settings you want to apply to those of the current ActivationObject object.
member.returns: The current ActivationObject object with its properties set to the values from the passed-in object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ActivationObject.Clone
member.summary: Creates an copy of the existing ActivationObject object.
member.returns: A new ActivationObject object with settings identical to those of the current ActivationObject object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ActivationObject.AllowActivation
member.summary: Enables the use of the ActivationObject object.
member.remarks: When AllowActivation is true, the ActivationObject is applied to objects in the grid in response to user input. An object must be activated in order for the user to edit data in the grid or add new data. When AllowActivation is false, keyboard input, such as navigation through rows/cells, editing data and the addition of new data are disabled. Default browser's input is not affected.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ActivationObject.BorderStyle
member.summary: The style that will be applied to the border of the active object.

remarks.p: When an object in the grid (row or cell) becomes active, its border will assume the style specified by the BorderStyle property. See for a list of available border styles.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ActivationObject.BorderColor
member.summary: The color that will be applied to the border of the active object.

remarks.p: When an object in the grid (row or cell) becomes active, its border will assume the color specified by the BorderColor property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ActivationObject.BorderWidth
member.summary: The width that will be applied to the border of the active object.

remarks.p: When an object in the grid (row or cell) becomes active, its border will assume the width specified by the BorderWidth property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ActivationObject.BorderDetails
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets a object that allows to customize the borders of the activation object.

remarks.p: Individual borders settings can be applied to every border of the activation object - left, top, right and bottom.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ActivationObject.HasBorderDetails
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value that determines whether the property is currently set to a object.

remarks.p: This property returns True if the BorderDetails property is currently set; otherwise, it returns False.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.AddNewBox
member.summary:
The AddNewBox class handles properties and methods directly related to the AddNewBox button, which can be used to add a new row to the grid. The AddNewBox contains one AddNewButton for each Band of data in the grid. A new row can only be added to a band that already contains the ActiveRow or ActiveCell. The new row will be added at the end of the current data island.
If the grid only contains 1 band, then the AddNewBox will contain one button and clicking it will cause a new row to be added at the bottom of the grid.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.SpecialBoxBase
member.summary: Base class for all box classes. It contains all common properties/methods

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.SpecialBoxBase.Reset
member.summary: Resets all properties of the class to their default values.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to reset all properties of the SpecialBoxBase class to their default values.
The "ShouldSerialize" properties of the SpecialBoxBase will retun False until set again.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.SpecialBoxBase.Style
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets a object that determines how a button object is rendered on the client.

remarks.p: This property is used to specify the default style of the button classes that inherit from the class, such as the and classes.
Individual style attributes can be applied by setting the GridItemStyle object's corresponding properties. For example, a style's background color can be changed by setting its BackColor property.
A comprehensive pre-defined style can be applied by setting the GridItemStyle object's CssClass property to the name of the style.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.SpecialBoxBase.ButtonConnectorColor
member.summary: Returns a refence to or sets a Color object that specifies the color of the button connector lines for an object.

remarks.p: This property is used to specify the color of the lines that are drawn between buttons, such as the and classes.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.SpecialBoxBase.ButtonConnectorStyle
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets a BorderStyle object that specifies the style of the button connector lines for an object.

remarks.p: This property is used to specify the way in which the lines that are drawn between buttons, such as the and classes, are rendered on the client.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.SpecialBoxBase.HasStyle
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value that determines whether the property is currently set to a object.

remarks.p: This property returns True if the Style property is currently set; otherwise, it returns False.

member.summary: Resets all properties of the class to their default values.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to reset all properties of the AddNewBox class to their default values.
The "ShouldSerialize" properties of the AddNewBox will retun False until set again.

member.summary: Duplicates the properties of the specified into the instance of the class from which this method is invoked.

remarks.p: Use the CopyFrom method to duplicate the properties of the specified SpecialBoxBase into the instance of the AddNewBox class from which this method is invoked.
All properties in the current instance of the SpecialBoxBase class will be replaced by their corresponding properties in the SpecialBoxBase object specified by the passin parameter.

param.name: passin
param.p: A SpecialBoxBase object that represents the base box class to copy.

member.summary: Returns a string representation of an object.

remarks.p: Some objects do not have values that can be converted to a string. In these cases, an empty string is returned.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.AddNewBox.Prompt
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that is displayed to the left of the box.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is "Add..."
If the AddNewBox button is hidden, the text specified by this property is not visible.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.AddNewBox.Location
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies where the box is rendered to the client.

remarks.p: The Top setting renders the AddNewBox button above the grid on the client.
The Bottom (default) setting renders the AddNewBox button below the grid on the client.

member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets a object that determines how the box is rendered on the client.

remarks.p: Individual style attributes can be applied by setting the GridItemStyle object's corresponding properties. For example, a style's background color can be changed by setting its BackColor property.
A comprehensive pre-defined style can be applied by setting the GridItemStyle object's CssClass property to the name of the style.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.AddNewBox.HasButtonStyle
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value that determines whether the property is currently set to a object.

remarks.p: This property returns True if the ButtonStyle property is currently set; otherwise, it returns False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.AddNewBox.Hidden
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether the box is hidden.

remarks.p: This property returns True if the AddNewBox button is currently hidden; otherwise, it returns False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.AddNewBox.View
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines the view style of the box.

remarks.p: The Full (default) setting displays a staggered appearance, with each Band button below the one before it, with right-angled connecting lines linking them.
The Compact setting displays a linear appearance, with each Band button to the right of the one before it, with straight connecting lines linking them.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.AutoStyle
member.summary: Summary description for AutoStyle.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.#ctor
member.summary: The UltraGridLayout object determines the settings of various properties related to the appearance and behavior of the object. The UltraGridLayout object provides a simple way to maintain multiple layouts for the grid and apply them as needed. You can also save grid layouts and restore them later.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.LoadLayout(System.String)

summary.p: Reads the Layout XML contained in the specified String object, either in its entirety, or only the style or behavior data contained in it.

remarks.p: Use this method to load layout data for the control from an XML string previously created using the method. Loading the layout changes the settings of the control's Layout object and modifies the appearance and behavior of the control accordingly. The user may not see the changes applied to the grid until a postback is performed.
This version of the LoadLayout method loads all information contained in the xml file and applies it to the DisplayLayout of the grid.

member.param: A string variable containing the XML that will be parsed and loaded into the grid. See the corresponding string version of SaveLayout for a method that saves the DisplayLayout object to and Xml string.

summary.p: Reads the Layout XML contained in the specified String object, either in its entirety, or only the style or behavior data contained in it.

remarks.p: Use this method to load layout data for the control from an XML string previously created using the method. Loading the layout changes the settings of the control's Layout object and modifies the appearance and behavior of the control accordingly. The user may not see the changes applied to the grid until a postback is performed.

param.name: bReadStyles
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the style data contained in the XML should be read. Specify True to read the style data. Style data includes colors, fonts borders, etc.

param.name: bReadBehaviors
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the behavior data contained in the XML should be read. Specify True to read the behavior data. Behavior data includes whether to allow column sorting, whether to allow column moving, cell click action, etc.

param.name: bReadColumns
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the column and band data contained in the XML should be read. Specify True to read column and band data.

param.name: bReadData
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether row and cell data contained in the XML should be read. Specify True to read the row and cell data.

summary.p: Reads the Layout XML contained in the specified XmlTextReader object, either in its entirety, or only the style or behavior data contained in it.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to read the layout XML contained in an XmlTextReader object, specified by the xmlReader parameter. Loading the layout changes the settings of the control's Layout object and modifies the appearance and behavior of the control accordingly. The user may not see the changes applied to the grid until a postback is performed.

param.name: xmlReader
param.p: An XmlTextReader object containing the layout data to be read. This version of the LoadLayout method loads all information contained in the xml file and applies it to the DisplayLayout of the grid.

summary.p: Reads the Layout XML contained in the specified XmlTextReader object, either in its entirety, or only the style or behavior data contained in it.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to read the layout XML contained in an XmlTextReader object, specified by the xmlReader parameter. Loading the layout changes the settings of the control's Layout object and modifies the appearance and behavior of the control accordingly. The user may not see the changes applied to the grid until a postback is performed.

param.name: xmlReader
param.p: An XmlTextReader object containing the layout data to be read.

param.name: bReadStyles
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the style data contained in the XML should be read. Specify True to read the style data. Style data includes colors, fonts borders, etc.

param.name: bReadBehaviors
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the behavior data contained in the XML should be read. Specify True to read the behavior data. Behavior data includes whether to allow column sorting, whether to allow column moving, cell click action, etc.

param.name: bReadColumns
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the column and band data contained in the XML should be read. Specify True to read column and band data.

param.name: bReadData
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether row and cell data contained in the XML should be read. Specify True to read the row and cell data.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.SaveLayout(System.String)
member.summary: Writes the property settings contained in the UltraGridLayout object to an XML file. The XML file can then be loaded again at a later time to restore the current appearance and behavior of the grid.

remarks.p: You can save the layout of the grid for use at a later time, either to restore the current state of the grid or to provide a selection of distinct states that the application or the user can apply as needed. This form of the SaveLayout method saves all information in the Layout object, including styles, behaviors, bands and columns, and rows and cells.
Use the method to restore the grid's layout from a saved file.

param.name: fileName
param.p: The filename of the XML file to be created. This must be a path on the sever that is accessible to the web application.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.SaveLayout(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the property settings contained in the UltraGridLayout object to an XML file. The XML file can then be loaded again at a later time to restore the current appearance and behavior of the grid.

remarks.p: You can save the layout of the grid for use at a later time, either to restore the current state of the grid or to provide a selection of distinct states that the application or the user can apply as needed. When creating the XML file, you can choose whether it should contain all Layout data, only the style-related settings, or only the behavior-related settings.
Use the method to restore the grid's layout from a saved file.

param.name: fileName
param.p: The filename of the XML file to be created. This must be a path on the sever that is accessible to the web application.

param.name: bWriteStyles
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the style data contained in the UltraGridLayout object should be written into the file. Specify True to write the style data. Style data includes colors, fonts borders, etc.

param.name: bWriteBehaviors
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the behavior data contained in the UltraGridLayout object should be written into the file. Specify True to write the behavior data. Behavior data includes whether to allow column sorting, whether to allow column moving, cell click action, etc.

param.name: bWriteColumns
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the band and column data contained in the UltraGridLayout object should be written into the file. Specify True to write the band and column data.

param.name: bWriteData
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the row and cell data contained in the UltraGridLayout object should be written into the file. Specify True to write the row and cell data.

summary.p: Writes the property settings contained in the UltraGridLayout object to an XML string and returns a reference to the string. The string returned can then be used again at a later time to restore the current appearance and behavior of the grid

remarks.p: You can save the layout of the grid for use at a later time, either to restore the current state of the grid or to provide a selection of distinct states that the application or the user can apply as needed. This version of the SaveLayout method saves all information in the Layout object, including styles, behaviors, bands and columns, and rows and cells.
Use the method to restore the grid's layout from an XML string.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to reset all properties of the Layout class to their default values.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.Clone
member.summary: Clones the Layout object, returning a new, identical UltraGridLayout object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.CopyFrom(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout)
member.summary: Copies the settings of the passed-in object to the current object. Any settings in the current object will be overwritten.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.Rows
member.summary: Returns a collection of the topmost level of rows in the grid. This collection will either contain all the rows in Band 0 or the top level of GroupBy rows (if GroupBy rows are being used.)

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.SelectTypeCellDefault
member.summary: Specifies the way cells can be selected on the client. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual bands.

remarks.p: This property specifies how the user can select cells. Available settings include None, Single and Extended. Users can be prevented from selecting cells, may select one cell at a time, or select multiple cells in a rectangular region, depending on the setting of this property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.SelectTypeRowDefault
member.summary: Specifies the way rows can be selected on the client. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual bands.

remarks.p: This property specifies how the user can select rows. Available settings include None, Single and Extended. Users can be prevented from selecting rows, may select one row at a time, or select multiple contiguous rows, depending on the setting of this property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.SelectTypeColDefault
member.summary: Specifies the way columns can be selected on the client. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual bands.

remarks.p: This property specifies how the user can select columns. Available settings include None, Single and Extended. Users can be prevented from selecting columns, may select one column at a time, or select multiple contiguous columns, depending on the setting of this property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.FrameStyle
member.summary: An object that contains the style properties for the control's frame.

remarks.p: Use this property to provide a custom style for the frame of the control. Common style attributes that can be adjusted include: forecolor, backcolor, font, and alignment. You can use different styles to provide a consistent look throughout your application, enhance the appearance of certain areas of the grid, or to call attention to important data.
Some properties of this style are used as base properties for all other styles. They include: background color, font, foreground color, cursor, horizontal and vertical alignment, and word wrap.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.IndentationDefault
member.summary: Determines the amount of indenting used for bands. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual bands.

remarks.p: You can use the IndentationDefault property to specify how much indenting should be applied to bands beyond the default indenting done by the control. The default value for this property is 22. The minimumn indentation value is also determined by the width of the igtbl_blank.gif image.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.GroupByRowDescriptionMaskDefault
member.summary: A string that determines what text is shown in GroupBy rows. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual bands.
member.remarks: The GroupByRowDescriptionMaskDefault property can include special substitution strings that will be replaced with information from the grid. For example, you can use them to specify child row count of a GroupBy row. By default, the [caption], [value], and [count] substitution strings are set. The column header text gets placed into the [caption] field, the common cell value gets placed into the [value] field, and the number of rows sharing the common value is placed into the [count] field.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.HasImageUrls
member.summary: Determines whether images were changed in the grid.

remarks.p: When this property is set to True, some images in the grid have been changed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.ImageUrls
member.summary: Object holder for images of the grid.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.JavaScriptFileName
member.summary: The base name and path for the JavaScript files that are used for client side behavior. The root name of the file, (ig_WebGrid) is used as the base for determining the other files that are contain related functionality. If this root file name is changed, then all other file names must be changed as well.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.JavaScriptFileNameCommon
member.summary: The relative path to the common javascript file.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.ExpandableDefault
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines if bands are expandable by default. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual bands.

remarks.p: The property determines whether the rows in a band can be expanded. If set to Expandable.No the row expansion (plus/minus) indicators will not be shown.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.Name
member.summary: The name of the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.AllowSortingDefault
member.summary: Specifies whether the user can sort columns. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual bands.
member.remarks: This property determines whether the user can sort the data in the band based on the values present in a column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.RowAlternateStyleDefault
member.summary: The default style that will be appplied to alternate (even numbered) rows. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: This property specifies a default style that will be applied to alternate rows. You can use this style to provide a distinct appearance for odd and even rows, making it easier for the user to read the data in the grid and distinguish between data records.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.CellPaddingDefault
member.summary: The amount of cell padding to use when rendering the grid. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual bands.
member.remarks: Cell padding is the amount of white space between the borders of the cell and the cell's contents. To specify the amount of space separating cells from one another, use .

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.CellSpacingDefault
member.summary: The amount of cell spacing to use when rendering the grid. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual bands.
member.remarks: Cell spacing is the amount of space separating cells from one another. To specify the amount of white space between the borders of the cell and the cell's contents, use .

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.HasClientSideEvents
member.summary: Indicates whether client-side events are active for the grid.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.ClientSideEvents
member.summary: Object holder for client-side event names.

remarks.p: Client-side events are events that occur in the web-browser, such as mouse-related events. Because the events are local to the browser, they must be implemented in JavaScript. Client-side events do not require a new connection to the server or a refresh of the current page. The other type of events found in the UltraWebGrid are server-side events. These events require the browser to make a new connection with the server in response to some event that occurs at the control level on the server, such as the addition of a new row of data.
When you are implementing client-side events in your application, your JavaScript routines should use the names provided by the ClientSideEvents property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.Bands
member.summary: A collection of Band objects. When used at the grid level, the collection includes all the Band objects in the control.
member.remarks: The Bands collection contains all of the Band objects in the grid. Each Band object represents a single level of a hierarchical data set.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.Pager
member.summary: Returns the object assoicated with the grid.

remarks.p: If the browser being used to view the grid data supports the use of an embedded scrolling grid, all the grid data can be displayed on a single web page with no problem. However, if the browser does not support a scrolling grid (or if you choose not to use one) then multiple rows of grid data will be displayed on multiple web pages, with a fixed number of grid rows appearing on each page. In this situation, the object handles the details of rendering those pages, and of handling user navigation of the data set.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.EditCellStyleDefault
member.summary: Specifies the style applied to the cell when it is in edit mode. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: This property is used to specify the appearance of the cell that is in edit mode. (The property indicates which cell is currently active; a cell that is being edited is always the active cell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.FooterStyleDefault
member.summary: The default style that will be applied to column footers in the band. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: This property specifies a default style that will be applied to all the column footers in the band. The style may be overridden by the band or by the individual object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.GridLinesDefault
member.summary: Specifies which cell borders should be shown in the band. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: Use this property to quickly format the display of the lines separating the cells in the grid. You can choose to show horizontal lines, vertical lines, both or neither.
Note In order for the grid lines to appear at all, it is necessary to have the Border Style, Color and/or Width set in the RowStyleDefault property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.HeaderStyleDefault
member.summary: The default style that will be applied to headers. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual bands or columns.

remarks.p: This property specifies a default style that will be applied to all column headers. The style may be overridden by the band or by the individual object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.RowsRange
member.summary: The number of rows that are retrieved at a time when the XML rendering is in progress.
member.remarks: This property is responsible for the rows payload from server to client when the XML rendering is used. Applies to Band 0 only. The rows range equals to the number of rows that are brought from server to client per each HTTP XML request. Initial number of rows and number of requested rows during scrolling depends on this value. Default value is 50. Value of -1 means no restriction on the rows payload are applied.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.RowSelectorStyleDefault
member.summary: The default style that will be applied to row selectors. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: This property specifies a default style that will be applied to all the row selectors. The style may be overridden by the band or by the individual object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.SelectedHeaderStyleDefault
member.summary: The default style that will be applied to selected headers. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: This property specifies a default style that will be applied to all selected headers. The style may be overridden by the band or by the individual object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.RowStyleDefault
member.summary: The default style that will be applied to rows. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: This property specifies a default style that will be applied to all the rows. The style may be overridden by the band or by the individual object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.GroupByRowStyleDefault
member.summary: The style used to format the GroupBy rows in the band. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: Use this property to provide a default style for GroupBy rows. Common style attributes that can be adjusted include: forecolor, backcolor, font, and alignment. You can use different styles to provide a consistent look throughout your application, enhance the appearance of certain areas of the grid, or to call attention to important data.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.SelectedGroupByRowStyleDefault
member.summary: The default style that will be applied to GroupBy rows that are selected. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: This property specifies a default style that will be applied to all selected GroupBy rows. The style may be overridden by the band or by the individual object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.SelectedRowStyleDefault
member.summary: The default style that will be applied to rows that are selected. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: This property specifies a default style that will be applied to all selected rows. The style may be overridden by the band or by the individual object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.ActiveRow
member.summary: Returns or sets the active row. This property is not available at design-time.

remarks.p: Use the ActiveRow property to determine which row is currently active, or change which row is currently active. If you assign an UltraGridRow object to the ActiveRow property, the specified row will become active.

Only one row at a time may be the active row. The active row contains the active cell, which is the cell that will receive input focus when the Grid goes into edit mode. You can determine which cell is the active cell using the property.

Note that changing the active row may have implications for the user, particularly if a cell is in edit mode. Changing the active row will also change the active cell. The event occurs when the active row is about to change. The event will also occur i response to a change inthe active cell.
If no row is active, this property will return null (Nothing). To deactivate the active row, set this property to null or Nothing.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.ActiveCell
member.summary: Returns or sets the active cell. This property is not available at design-time.

remarks.p: Use the ActiveCell property to determine which cell is currently active, or change which cell is currently active. If you assign an UltraGridCell object to the ActiveCell property, the specified cell will become active. Only one cell at a a time may be the active cell; the active cell is the one which currently has the input focus. A cell that is being edited is wlways the active cell.

Note that changing the active cell may have implications for the user, particularly if the cell is in edit mode. Changing the active cell may also change the active row. The event occurs when the active cell is about to change. If the active row also changes, the event will also occur.
If no cell is active, this property will return null (Nothing). To deactivate any active cell in the grid, set this property to null or Nothing.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.AllowAddNewDefault
member.summary: Determines whether the user is allowed to add a new row of data. This is the default value for the grid and may be overridden by individual bands.

remarks.p: This property determines whether the user can add new rows to the data in the band or the grid. This property also controls the appearance of the buttons in the AddNew box. If AllowAddNew is set to AllowAddNew.No for a particular band, that band's button will be disabled in the AddNew box. This prevents the user from adding new data to the specified band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.AllowDeleteDefault
member.summary: Determines whether the user is allowed to delete rows. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual bands.
member.remarks: This property determines whether the user can delete rows of data from the band or the grid. It does not control the deletion of data within individual cells (field-level deletion) only the removal of complete records from the data source (record-level deletion).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.AllowRowNumberingDefault
member.summary: Determines whether the UltraWebGrid will render row numbers on the RowSelectors, and if so, which numbering schema it will use.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.EnableClientSideRenumbering
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not row renumbering will be done on the client side.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.AllowUpdateDefault
member.summary: Determines whether the user is allowed to update data. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual bands.
member.remarks: This property determines whether to permit changes to the data displayed in the band or the grid. All data entry functionality is disabled when AllowUpdate is set to False. Cell contents cannot be edited. Users can still view data, select all or part of it and copy it to the clipboard. They can also re-arrange the layout of the grid by moving and resizing columns, groups, rows, etc. (provided these features are not also disabled using the appropriate properties.)

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.AllowColSizingDefault
member.summary: Determines whether the user is allowed to change the width of columns. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual bands.
member.remarks: The AllowColSizingDefault property specifies how column resizing will be handled in the grid. When AllowColSizingDefault is set to AllowSizing.Fixed, no resizing is allowed. When AllowColSizingDefault is set to AllowSizing.Free, columns can be resized on the client. Setting the TableLayout property to TableLayout.Fixed provides ability to resize columns regardless of the data that is inside their cells. If the property is set to TableLayout.Auto, columns can be resized only within the free space, that is not occupied by cells' data.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.RowSizingDefault
member.summary: Specifies whether and how the user can change the height of the rows. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual bands.

remarks.p: The RowSizing property specifies whether the user can resize rows using the mouse in the band or the grid and, if they can, how that resizing is accomplished. The grid can also resize rows automatically, based on the amount of data present in the cells that make up the row. If one cell contains a large amount of text, the row can be resized to accommodate all the text, or a particular number of lines of text, provided the cell is capable of displaying multiple lines of text. The RowSizing property also determines whether rows are resized independently of one another, or whether their heights are synchronized.

When using one of the auto-sizing settings, the size of each row is determined by the number of lines of text required to display the contents of a cell. The cell in the row that displays the most lines of text determines the size of the entire row. The CellMultiLine property is used to specify whether the text in a cell will wrap to multiple lines.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.ColWidthDefault
member.summary: The default width of columns in the control, in Units.

remarks.p: This default value may be overridden at the band level or the column level. At the band level, the property controls the default width of columns added to the band. At the column level, the property specifies the width of the individual column.
The default value for this property is 100 (pixels).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.HasRowAlternateStyleDefault
member.summary: Determines if a style has been applied to alternate grid rows at the band level. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: Returns True if a default style for alternate (even-numbered) grid rows has been set at the layout level (through the property.) If False, the style of alternate rows will be inherited (or taken from the band or the overriding property of the UltraGridRow object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.HasSelectedHeaderStyleDefault
member.summary: Determines if a style for selected column headers has been applied at the band level. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: Returns True if a default style for selected column headers has been set at the layout level (through the property.) If False, the style of selected headers will be inherited.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.HasRowSelectorStyleDefault
member.summary: Determines if a style has been applied to the row selectors at the band level. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: Returns True if a default style for the row selectors has been set at the layout level (through the property.) If False, the row selector style will be inherited (or taken from the band or the overriding property of the UltraGridRow object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.HasEditCellStyleDefault
member.summary: Determines if a style has been applied to the edit cell. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: Returns True if the edit cell style has been specifically set (through the property.) If False, the edit cell has no style of its own and its appearance will be inherited.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.HasFrameStyle
member.summary: Determines if a style has been applied to the control's frame.

remarks.p: Returns True if the style of the control's frame has been specifically set (through the property. If False, the frame has no style of its own and it will use the default appearance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.HasHeaderStyleDefault
member.summary: Determines if a style has been applied to the band header. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: Returns True if the default header style has been specifically set (through the property. If False, the band header has no style of its own and its appearance will be inherited.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.HasFooterStyleDefault
member.summary: Determines if a style has been applied to the column footers at the layout level. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: Returns True if a default style for the column footers has been specifically set at the layout level (through the property.) If False, the column footer style will be inherited (or taken from the band or the overriding property of the UltraGridColumn object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.HasRowStyleDefault
member.summary: Determines if a style has been applied to rows at the band level. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: Returns True if a default style for rows has been set at the layout level (through the property.) If False, the style of the band's rows will be inherited (or taken from the band or the overriding property of the UltraGridRow object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.HasRowExpAreaStyleDefault
member.summary: Determines if a style has been applied to rows. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: Returns True if a default style for rows has been set at the layout level (through the property.) If False, the style of the band's rows will be inherited (or taken from the band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.HasSelectedRowStyleDefault
member.summary: Determines if a style for selected rows has been applied at the band level. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: Returns True if a default style for selected rows has been set at the layout level (through the property.) If False, the style of selected rows will be inherited.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.HasGroupByRowStyleDefault
member.summary: Determines if a style has been applied to GroupBy rows at the layout level.

remarks.p: Returns True if a default style for GroupBy rows has been specifically set at the layout level (through the property.) If False, the style of GroupBy rows will be inherited (or taken from the band or the overriding property of the UltraGridRow object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.HasSelectedGroupByRowStyleDefault
member.summary: Determines if a style for selected GroupBy rows has been applied at the band level. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: Returns True if a default style for selected GroupBy rows has been set at the layout level (through the property.) If False, the style of selected GroupBy rows will be inherited.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.NullTextDefault
member.summary: Specifies how null values will be represented in the grid. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: This property spcifies a string value that will be displayed in a grid cell whenever a null value is received for that cell from the back end. The default setting is to use an empty string (""). However, you can specify any string you want, such as the words "null" or "empty".

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.RowHeightDefault
member.summary: The default height that will be appplied to all rows. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: This property specifies a default height that will be applied to all rows. The style may be overridden by the band or by the individual object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.TableLayout
member.summary: Specifies the type of CSS table layout in effect.

remarks.p: If this value is set to Auto, the heights and widths of rows and columns are interpreted by the browser as if they were recommendations. The browser may still make adjustments to the table layout, as needed, for displaying the maximum amount of information. Ordinarily, this is the default (see note about stationary margins and fixed columns below).
If this property value is set to Fixed, the browser will treat all row and column dimensions (height and width) as requirements, forcing them to their specified values (if any).
The grid requires the table layout to be Fixed when the or feature is used.
This option is only effective when rendering to up-level browsers.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.Tag
member.summary: A field for storing user-defined, object-related information. If set, the object must support serialization.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.ViewType
member.summary: Specifies how the grid will display data.

remarks.p: This property specifies the type of view that will be used to display data in the grid. Available settins are Flat, Heirarchical, and Outlook GroupBy. If this property is set to Flat, non-hierarchical data will be displayed, and only Band 0 of the grid will be used. Even if multiple relations are present in the datasource, the grid will display only the first band of data. Hierarchical is the standard multi-band view of grid data, with rows expanding and collapsing to reveal records from related tables that correspond to the visible records in the top-level band. Outlook GroupBy uses the grouping metaphor found in Microsoft Outlook to display records grouped by criteria under common headings that can be expanded or collasped.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.RowSelectorsDefault
member.summary: Specifies whether row selectors will be displayed. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual bands.

remarks.p: This property specifies the default visibility for row selectors. This setting may be overridden by the band or by the individual object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.CellClickActionDefault
member.summary: Specifies what action will occur when a cell is clicked. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual bands.

remarks.p: This property specifies what will occur when the user navigates through the grid by clicking on cells in the band or the grid. You can choose whether cells that are clicked will put the cell into edit mode or select the cell or its row. Depending on your application, you may want the user to edit any cell just by clicking on it, or you may want to require a separate action to trigger cell editing, such as double-clicking or a keystroke combination. Similarly, you can choose whether cells should be individually selectable, or if selecting the row is a sufficient response to clicking on a cell.

Note that how selection behaves on the client side depends heavily on the capabilities fo the browser. In downlevel browsers, the grid will be rendered using standard HTML, and HTML selection rules will apply.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.Grid
member.summary: Returns a reference to the UltraWebGrid object that contains the Layout.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.ColFootersVisibleDefault
member.summary: Determines whether to show column footers. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual bands.

remarks.p: Column footers can be enabled for a band, providing a convenient way to display column-related information. For example, you can display the total of a column of figure, or th e number of items checked in a checkbox column.
When you enable column footers for a band, the footers will appear, but you must still specify what information they will contain. You can do this through the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.ColHeadersVisibleDefault
member.summary: Determines whether to show column headers. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual bands.

remarks.p: Column headers can be enabled for a band, providing labeling and additional functionality for columns. A column header typically contains the formatted name of the field to which the column is bound. Column headers are also used to manipulate columns in various activities, such as column moving and when implementing GroupBy mode.
Column headers may be formatted through the , and properties of the UltraGridColumn object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.SelectedRows
member.summary: Returns a collection of the currently selected rows. Not available at design-time.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.SelectedCells
member.summary: Returns a collection of the currently selected cells. Not available at design-time.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.SelectedColumns
member.summary: Returns a collection of the currently selected columns. Not available at design-time.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.GroupByBox
member.summary: Returns a reference to the GroupByBox object. This property is read-only at design-time and run-time.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.EnableInternalRowsManagement
member.summary: Controls whether all rows are stored in viewstate, or only the rows that apply to the current page.

remarks.p: If the property is set to true, all Rows from the data source are stored in ViewState and the application doesn't need to respond to page changes or column sorting events. If the property is set to false, the application must handle the PageIndexChange, SortColumn, GroupBy and UnGroupBy events by invoking the method.
If paging is not in effect, then this property has no effect.
Note Having this property set to true may increase the size of the ViewState considerably depending upon the total number of rows in the data source versus the number of rows in a page.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.AllowColumnMovingDefault
member.summary: Enables or disables column moving on either server or client side.
member.remarks: Use this property to specify how the control will handle column moving. If set to None, column moving is disallowed and all columns are stationary. If set to OnServer, all column moving is handled on the server and the control will perform a postback whenever the user moves a column to retrieve the new layout. However, the size of the viewstate will be increased to support column moving. The OnClient setting is available only when the Browser property of the grid is set to Xml. In this case the client side render engine transforms the Xml data that is already on the client to match the columns order desired by the user.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.HeaderClickActionDefault
member.summary: Specifies how a column header should react to being clicked. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual bands or columns.

remarks.p: This property specifies a default header click action that will be applied to all column headers. The header click action may be overridden by the band or by the individual object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.AddNewBox
member.summary: Returns a reference to the AddNewBox object. This property is read-only at design-time and run-time.

remarks.p: The AddNewBox object represents the AddNew Box interface for entering new data rows into the grid.

The conventional approach for adding data to a grid has been to place an empty row at the bottom of the grid. New data is entered into this row and appended to the data source, then the row reserved for new data entry is cleared and moved down to appear below the newly added row. However, when working with a hierarchical recordset, this metaphor is no longer effective. Multiple bands of data are represented as distinct groups of rows, and which group of rows receives the new data is significant. Simply adding new data to the last row in a band will not position the new record correctly with respect to the band's parent recordset.

To effectively add new data to a hierarchical recordset, the UltraGrid implements an interface called the "AddNew Box." The AddNew Box displays one or more buttons that are used to trigger the addition of new data. The number of buttons corresponds to the number of hierarchical bands displayed. Each band has its own AddNew button, and connecting lines link the buttons, illustrating a hierarchical relationship that mirrors that of the data.

To use the AddNew Box, you first set focus to a row or cell in the band to which you want to add data. You should determine where in the hierarchy you want the record to appear, then select a record that corresponds to that location. You then click the AddNew button for the band you want to contain the new data, and an empty data entry row appears in the band a the point you selected. For example, if you have a Customers/Orders hierarchy and you wanted to add data for a new order, you would first locate the customer to whom the order belonged, select that customer's record (or one of that customer's existing order records) and click the AddNew button for the Orders band. A blank row would appear below any existing orders that were displayed for the customer.

The AddNewBox object contains properties that control the various attributes of the AddNew Box interface. For example, you can use the Hidden property of the AddNewBox object to selectively display or hide the interface, thus enabling or disabling the user's ability to add new data. You can also use this object to control the appearance of the AddNew buttons, and specify other formatting features. You can also chose between the standard and compact display styles for the AddNew Box. The compact style preserves screen space by compressing the display of the AddNew buttons and eliminating the display of a hierarchical structure.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.ActivationObject
member.summary: Returns a reference to the ActivationObject object. This property is read-only at design-time and run-time.

remarks.p: The object determines the formatting that will be applied to activated items in the grid, and also whether or not activation will be permitted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.HasAddNewBox
member.summary: Indicates whether the control has an AddNew Box object.

remarks.p: You can use this property to determine whether the control has an AddNew Box. The AddNew Box is used to add new records to a hierarchical data set. If the grid is only displaying a single-level (flat) dataset, the AddNew Box is not necessary.
If the control is using an Add New box, you can access its properties using the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.HasActivationObject
member.summary: Specifies whether the control has an ActivationObject object.

remarks.p: Use this property to determine whether there is an ActivationObject object for the control. The ActivationObject object will be present if the grid allows selection and/or editing of the displayed data. To access the settings of the ActivationObject object, use the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.CompactRendering
member.summary: Specifies how the HTML code for the control will be generated.

remarks.p: This property specifies the way HTML code is generated. By default this property is true which means that HTML will be generated with no extra white space; tab characters and line breaks will be omitted. This reduces the size of the resulting HTML page, and the number of bytes that must travel to the browser, howwever it makes the code difficult to read. For debugging purposes this property can be set to false and all generated code will be presented in human-readable form.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.DefaultCentury
member.summary: Default century that is used for two digit years. Default value is 1900.

remarks.p: If user input is setup to accept two digit years this value will be added to the entered year. The property accepts only 100 even values.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.StationaryMargins
member.summary: Specifies which parts of the grid will remain stationary when scrolling occurs.

remarks.p: This property specifies which part of the grid is stationary. Headers and footers may be made stationary, allowing them to remain in view while data rows are scrolled up or down. This property provides a choice of stationary headers, stationary footers or both stationary headers and footers. By default there will be no stationary parts in the grid.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.ReadOnly
member.summary: Determines whether the grid will be in read-only mode.

remarks.p: This property sets the grid to the read-only mode. There are several implications of making this selection. Most importantly, is that the grid's data cannot be edited by the end user, and new data cannot be added into (or removed from) the grid. Read-only mode reduces overhead and download time for the web page containing the grid, by dispensing with the JavaScript required for data insert, update and deletion support.
There are three levels of read-only functionality supported, described here in order of most to least restrictive.

The most constrained level offers only rudimentary client-side functionality, with the least overhead. Data is simply presented on the end user's browser with the end user having no capability to alter their view of that data. This is referred to as LevelZero.

An intermediate level provides end users with some ability to manipultate the viewed data. This includes expansion and collapse of rows, and the resizing of columns. These features incur greater overhead for the page, although the quantity and demands of the JavaScript remains much lower than what is required for full interactivity. This is referred to as LevelOne.
The most accomodative read-only mode allows stationary header and footer capabilities, in addition to everything afforded to the end user in the prior level. This is referred to as LevelTwo.

Developers may set this property to NotSet to allow their end users to experience the full and unlimited interactivity of the UltraWebGrid. This is the default state (i.e., read-only mode is initially turned off). When a data application does not require editing capability, and performance or down-level compatibility must be maximized, setting the grid into read-only mode is advisable.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.BorderCollapseDefault
member.summary: Sets or returns a value that specifies whether the grid borders should collapse or not.

remarks.p: By collapsing the borders, the grid maintains a uniform border width, even when the borders of two objects appear beside one another. This is the default value for the grid that will be inherited by other objects who do not have their BorderCollapse property set to an explicit value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.RowExpAreaStyleDefault
member.summary: The default style that will be applied to rows expansion area. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: This property specifies a default style that will be applied to all the rows expasion areas, the ones behind plus or minus sign. The style may be overridden by the band object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.AutoGenerateColumns
member.summary: Specifies whether the grid should generate any columns automatically when data binding occurs.

remarks.p: At design-time set this property to true and all of the bound columns will be generated. At run-time, if this property is true and there are no columns that were automatically generated (all the properties are false) then all of the columns from the data source will be added to the existing columns in the grid.
You can add your own columns to the grid in addition to the columns generated by the control. By default, any columns you add appear to the left of the columns generated automatically.

summary.p: Returns or sets an enumerated value that determines how data is loaded into the grid at runtime.

remarks.p: The purpose of this property is to allow for a minimum amount of data to be rendered to the client, based upon which rows have been expanded by the user. The values for this property can be set to Manual, Automatic or NotSet based on the LoadOnDemand enumeration.

If the value is LoadOnDemand.Manual, the event is fired whenever a row needs to be expanded but does not have children associated with it. The children of the expanded row can then be loaded from within the OnDemandLoad event. Using LoadOnDemand.Manual, it is necessary to have Band objects created for each level of Rows that may be expanded using plus (+) images. If there is no Band object for rows that may be expanded, the WebGrid will not display a plus sign next to rows in the parent Band.

The LoadOnDemand.Automatic setting requires that UltraWebGrid is bound to a DataSet that includes relations that define the parent child relationships.For LoadOnDemand.Automatic, UltraWebGrid will first populate only the top level rows from the DataSet. Those rows that have children in the DataSet will be rendered with a plus image. When the plus image is clicked to expand, UltraWebGrid will post back to the server and automatically load the child rows for the row that was clicked. In order to load the proper rows on post-back, DataBind needs to be called for UltraWebGrid each time.

In order to the maximum performance benefit from the LoadOnDemand feature, it is recommended that ViewState be turned off for the control. For more information on using LoadOnDemand, see the LoadOnDemand topic in the Introduction section of the help system.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.ScrollBar
member.summary: Specifies how the scroll bar will be shown.

remarks.p: You can choose how to display the scrollbar in the control. The default setting is to display the scrollbar automatically when it is needed. You can also choose to always display the scrollbar or to never display the scrollbar. (If the scrollbar is not displayed, the user must use the data navigation features of the grid to scroll to data that is not currently visible.)

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.ScrollBarView
member.summary: Customizes the scroll bar view.

remarks.p: You can choose the view the scroll bar appear in the grid. The default setting is to display both horizontal and vertical scroll bars.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.NoDataMessage
member.summary: A string value that specifies the message that should be displayed when the grid contains no data. A column structure is considered data, so that if you have columns defined but no rows, then you will see the columns, but if you have no columns and no rows that is considered no data.

remarks.p: The default message is "No Data To Display".

remarks.p: When this property is set to True, some strings in the grid have been changed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.FixedColumnScrollType
member.summary: Specifies theway the grid is scrolled horizontally when it's in the fixed headers mode.

remarks.p: Default value is Pixel. That means that the grid is scrolled in a traditional way where the scrolling unit is one pixel. When it set to Column the scrolling unit becomes one column, that means that the user can scroll only one column at a time. Setting it to Column helps to improve the scrolling performance when there are many rows in the grid.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.ViewState
member.summary: Gets a dictionary of state information (StateBag) that allows you to save and restore the view state of a server control across multiple requests for the same page.

remarks.p: A server control's view state is the accumulation of all its property values. In order to preserve these values across HTTP requests, ASP.NET server controls use this property, which is an instance of the StateBag class, to store the property values. The values are then passed as a variable to an HTML hidden input element when subsequent requests are processed. For more information about saving server control view state, see Maintaining State in a Control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.FormulaErrorStyleDefault
member.summary: The default GridItemStyle object that contains the style properties applied to calculated cells containing UltraCalc formula errors.

remarks.p: The FormulaErrorStyleDefault property is used to specify the default visual formatting of cells and column footers whose calculated formula resulted in an error.
These default style properties can be overriden at the band, column and column footer levels by explicitly setting properties on their FormulaErrorStyle objects.
This property has no effect on the grid if UltraCalc formulas are not used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridLayout.HasFormulaErrorStyleDefault
member.summary: Determines if a default style has been applied to the cells for use when their UltraCalc formula results in an error.

remarks.p: Returns True if a style for cells in this UltraWebGrid layout has been specified in the event their calculated formula values result in error.

These default styles can be subsequently overriden at the band, column and column footer levels. Where a calculation error results and is being rendered and there is no overriding FormulaErrorStyle in effect, the , if any, is applied.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.RowEditItem
member.summary: The RowEditItem class functions as a container into which the editing template for a row is instantiated.

remarks.p: Once the row template has been instantiated and data bound, you can use the RowEditItem property to access the controls that make up the template. This property returns a collection of objects that correspond to the controls that make up the template. Use RowEditItem to access these controls and any children they may contain.
There is only one row edit item per band. All rows in the band make use of the same row editing template.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.RowEditItem.#ctor(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand)
member.summary: Assigns the current RowEditItem to the specified Band.
member.param: The UltraGridBand object of the band to which the current RowEditItem will be assigned.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand
member.summary: The UltraGridBand object represents a single level of a hierarchical record set. The columns that make up a band are typically drawn from a single recordsource (table) in the data source.

remarks.p: The UltraGridBand object represents a set of related columns. These columns generally correspond to the fields in a recordset, but can also include computed columns added by the programmer. A band represents a grouping of all the data at a single level in a hierarchical recordset. In the case of flat data there is only 1 band, whereas a grid with hierarchical data will have multiple bands.
Although the Band object does not directly own any rows within the row hierarchy, it does control the appearance and behavior of those rows within its level of influence.
