member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.GridID
member.summary: The control ID of the UltraWebGrid to which the current band belongs.
member.value: The control ID identifying the UltraWebGrid that currently owns this instance, or an empty string if there is not present owner.

remarks.p: This read-only property is only available programmatically at run-time. It allows developers to identify the UltraWebGrid control by its ID that currently owns this Band (and by extension, any objects that maintain a reference to their band, such as rows and columns).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.GroupByRowStyle
member.summary: An object that contains the style properties for the GroupBy rows in the band.

remarks.p: Use this property to provide a custom style for the band's GroupBy rows. Common style attributes that can be adjusted include: forecolor, backcolor, font, and alignment. You can use different styles to provide a consistent look throughout your application, enhance the appearance of certain areas of the grid, or to call attention to important data.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.SelectedGroupByRowStyle
member.summary: An object that contains the style properties for the GroupBy rows in the band that have been selected.

remarks.p: Use this property to provide a custom style for the band's selected GroupBy rows. Common style attributes that can be adjusted include: forecolor, backcolor, font, and alignment. You can use different styles to provide a consistent look throughout your application, enhance the appearance of certain areas of the grid, or to call attention to important data.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.RowSelectors
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines whether row selectors will be displayed.

remarks.p: Row selectors (also called record selectors) are the part of the grid interface that appear at the left edge of each row. Row selectors provide information about the state of the rows (which row is currently active, which rows have uncommitted edits) and you can click on a row selector to select the entire row at once. You can choose to display row selectors or not, either for the whole grid or on a band-by-band basis. The RowSelectors property specifies whether row selectors will be displayed in the current band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.RowSelectorsResolved
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines whether row selectors will be displayed. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the band.

remarks.p: Row selector visibility is controlled by the property. However, if a band is a child of another band, RowSelectors may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the parent band. If the parent band is a child of another band, it may also be inheriting a value for this property, so its own RowSelectors property would also be set to the "use deafult" setting. Even if the band is a top-level band, RowSelectors may be set to its "use default" value, which means the value used is the preset one built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out whether row selectors are enabled in the current band, use the RowSelectorsResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you whether row selectors are visible in the band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.RowSelectorStyle
member.summary: An object that contains the style properties for the row selectors in the band.

remarks.p: Use this property to provide a custom style for the band's row selectors. Common style attributes that can be adjusted include: forecolor, backcolor, font, and alignment. You can use different styles to provide a consistent look throughout your application, enhance the appearance of certain areas of the grid, or to call attention to important data.

Row selectors appear to the left of row data in the grid. By clicking on a row selector, the user can activate and select a specific row. The setting of this property may be overridden at the row level.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.DataKeyField
member.summary: The key field of the table being used as the data source of the band. This property tells UltraWebGrid which column from the database to load into the DataKey property of each Row as it is read and initialized in the grid. Later, the DataKey property of each row can be used as a lookup key to apply changes from the row to the database.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.RowAlternateStyle
member.summary: An object that contains the style properties for alternate (even-numbered) rows in the band.

remarks.p: Use this property to provide a custom style for the alternate rows in the band. Common style attributes that can be adjusted include: forecolor, backcolor, font, and alignment. You can use different styles to provide a consistent look throughout your application, enhance the appearance of certain areas of the grid, or to call attention to important data.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.Columns
member.summary: Returns a collection of the columns that make up the band.
member.remarks: Use this property to obtain a collection of UltraGridColumn objects that includes all the columns that make up the band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.DefaultColWidth
member.summary: The default width of columns in the band. This value is overridden by any width setings at the column level.
member.remarks: This is the setting applied to columns when they are first added to the band without their own setting. Setting this property to empty value removes the default column width from the band. Columns without a set width may then inherit their width from the band's parent.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.DefaultRowHeight
member.summary: The default height of rows in the band. This value is overridden by any height setings at the row level.
member.remarks: This is the setting applied to rows when they are first added to the band without their own setting. Setting this property to 0 removes the default row height from the band. Rows without a set height may then inherit their height from the band's parent.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.Expandable
member.summary: Determines whether the band can be expanded and collapsed.

remarks.p: The Expandable property determines whether the rows in a band can be expanded. If set to Expandable.No, the row expansion (plus/minus) indicators will not be shown.
The and properties determine the images that will be used to indicate to the user that a band may be expanded or collapsed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.Index
member.summary: Returns the index of the band object within the Bands collection

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.Tag
member.summary: A field for storing user-defined, object-related information. If viewstate is enabled, any object object assigned to a Tag property must support the ISerializable interface. Basic types are generally serializable but application defined objects may need to implement ISerializable in order to be placed into viewstate.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.AddButtonCaption
member.summary: Returns or sets the caption text of the Band's Add button.
member.remarks: When the AddNew box is displayed, it contains a button for each band in the grid. The buttons are arranged in a hierarchical display that mimics the arrangement of the bands in the grid. The user can click the appropriate button to add a new row to the indicated band. The AddButtonCaption property determines what will be displayed on the AddNew box button for the current band. By default, this property uses the name of the recordset that it retrieves from the data provider (if it is available).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.AddButtonToolTipText
member.summary: Returns or sets the text used as the Add button's tool tip

remarks.p: When the AddNew box is displayed, it contains a button for each band in the grid. The buttons are arranged in a hierarchical display that mimics the arrangement of the bands in the grid. The user can click the appropriate button to add a new row to the indicated band. The AddButtonToolTipText property determines what will be displayed in the tooltip that appears when the mouse is over the AddNew box button for the current band. By default, this property is set to an empty string("") indicating that no tooltip will be displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.AllowAdd
member.summary: Determines whether the user is allowed to add a new row of data.

remarks.p: This property determines whether the user can add new rows to the data in the band or the grid. This property also controls the appearance of the buttons in the AddNew box. If AllowAddNew is set to AllowAddNew.No for a particular band, that band's button will be disabled in the AddNew box. This prevents the user from adding new data to the specified band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.AllowDelete
member.summary: Determines whether the user is allowed to delete rows.
member.remarks: This property determines whether the user can delete rows of data from the band or the grid. It does not control the deletion of data within individual cells (field-level deletion) only the removal of complete records from the data source (record-level deletion).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.AllowDeleteResolved
member.summary: Determines whether the user is allowed to delete rows. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the band.

remarks.p: Record deletion is controlled by the property. However, if a band is a child of another band, AllowDelete may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the parent band. If the parent band is a child of another band, it may also be inheriting a value for this property, so its own AllowDelete property would also be set to the "use deafult" setting. Even if the band is a top-level band, AllowDelete may be set to its "use default" value, which means the value used is the preset one built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out whether records can be deleted in the current band, use the AllowDeleteResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you whether record deletion is allowed for the band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.HeaderClickAction
member.summary: Specifies how a column header should react to being clicked.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.HeaderStyle
member.summary: An object that contains the style properties for the band header.

remarks.p: Use this property to provide a custom style for the band's header. Common style attributes that can be adjusted include: forecolor, backcolor, font, and alignment. You can use different styles to provide a consistent look throughout your application, enhance the appearance of certain areas of the grid, or to call attention to important data.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.SelectedHeaderStyle
member.summary: An object that contains the style properties for the selected headers in the band.

remarks.p: Use this property to provide a custom style for the band's selected headers. Common style attributes that can be adjusted include: forecolor, backcolor, font, and alignment. You can use different styles to provide a consistent look throughout your application, enhance the appearance of certain areas of the grid, or to call attention to important data.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.Hidden
member.summary: Determines whether the band is visible.
member.remarks: If this property is set to True, the band is hidden, and any rows it contains will not be visible. Note that this will effectively block access to the any children those rows may have as well.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.Indentation
member.summary: Determines the amount of indenting used for bands.

remarks.p: You can use this property to specify how much indenting should be applied to bands beyond the default indenting done by the control. The default value for this property is 22, which indicates that the grid's default indenting should be used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.IndentationResolved
member.summary: Determines the amount of indenting used for bands. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the band.

remarks.p: Band indenting is controlled by the property. However, if a band is a child of another band, Indentation may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the parent band. If the parent band is a child of another band, it may also be inheriting a value for this property, so its own Indentation property would also be set to the "use deafult" setting. Even if the band is a top-level band, Indentation may be set to its "use default" value, which means the value used is the preset one built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out whether extra indenting is applied to the current band (and if so, how much is being applied) use the IndentationResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you how much extra indentation (if any) is applied to the band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.HasSortedColumns
member.summary: Determines whether the band contains sorted columns.

remarks.p: If column sorting is eanbled for a band ( returns True) then one or more of columns in the band may be in sorted order, depending on the actions taken by the end user. If the band contains sorted columns, HasSortedColumns property will return True and the property will return a collection of all the columns that have been sorted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.SortedColumns
member.summary: Returns a collection of UltraGridColumn objects that includes all of the columns in the band which have been sorted.

remarks.p: In order for the end user to be able to sort columns, the property must be set to True or have an inherited value of True. (You can determine the value that is in effect for the band by using the property.)
When the user sorts a column, the UltraGridColumn object of the sorted column is added to the band's collection of sorted columns. This collection is accessed through the SortedColumns property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.ColFootersVisible
member.summary: Determines whether to show column footers.

remarks.p: Column footers can be enabled for a band, providing a convenient way to display column-related information. For example, you can display the total of a column of figure, or th e number of items checked in a checkbox column.
When you enable column footers for a band, the footers will appear, but you must still specify what information they will contain. You can do this through the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.ColFootersVisibleResolved
member.summary: Determines whether to show column footers. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the band.

remarks.p: The visibility of column footers is controlled by the property. However, if a band is a child of another band, ColumnFootersVisible may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the parent band. If the parent band is a child of another band, it may also be inheriting a value for this property, so its own ColumnFootersVisible property would also be set to the "use deafult" setting. Even if the band is a top-level band, ColumnFootersVisible may be set to its "use default" value, which means the value used is the preset one built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out whether column footers are visible in the current band, use the ColumnFootersVisibleResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you if column footers are being displayed in the band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.ColHeadersVisible
member.summary: Determines whether to show column headers.

remarks.p: Column headers can be enabled for a band, providing labeling and additional functionality for columns. A column header typically contains the formatted name of the field to which the column is bound. Column headers are also used to manipulate columns in various activities, such as column moving and when implementing GroupBy mode.
Column headers may be formatted through the and properties of the UltraGridColumn object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.ColHeadersVisibleResolved
member.summary: Determines whether to show column headers. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the band.

remarks.p: The visibility of column headers is controlled by the property. However, if a band is a child of another band, ColumnHeadersVisible may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the parent band. If the parent band is a child of another band, it may also be inheriting a value for this property, so its own ColumnHeadersVisible property would also be set to the "use deafult" setting. Even if the band is a top-level band, ColumnHeadersVisible may be set to its "use default" value, which means the value used is the preset one built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out whether column headers are visible in the current band, use the ColumnHeadersVisibleResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you if column headers are being displayed in the band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.CurrentRowImage
member.summary: The name of the selected row image.
member.remarks: The image specified by this property is displayed beside whatever row is currently selected in the band. The usual appearance of this icon is a small triangle.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.CurrentEditRowImage
member.summary: The name of the selected editable row image.
member.remarks: The image specified by this property is displayed beside whatever row is currently selected in the band that has template for editing a row. The usual appearance of this icon is a small triangle with a pen.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.CollapseImage
member.summary: The name of the image used as the "collapse rows" icon.
member.remarks: The image specified by this property is displayed beside any row that has expanded child rows capable of being collapsed. The usual appearance of this icon is a small minus sign.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.ExpandImage
member.summary: The name of the image used as the "expand rows" icon.
member.remarks: The image specified by this property is displayed beside any row that has child rows capable of being expanded. The usual appearance of this icon is a small plus sign.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.SelectTypeCell
member.summary: Determines the type of selection that may be performed on cells in the band.

remarks.p: This property controls the selection of cells in the band. You can choose to disallow cell selection, allow the selection of only one cell or of multiple cells.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.SelectTypeRow
member.summary: Determines the type of selection that may be performed on rows in the band.

remarks.p: This property controls the selection of rows in the band. You can choose to disallow row selection, allow the selection of only one row or of multiple rows.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.SelectTypeCol
member.summary: Determines the type of selection that may be performed on columns in the band.

remarks.p: This property controls the selection of columns in the band. You can choose to disallow column selection, allow the selection of only one column or of multiple columns.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.CellClickAction
member.summary: Specifies what action will occur when a cell is clicked.

remarks.p: This property specifies what will occur when the user navigates through the grid by clicking on cells in the band or the grid. You can choose whether cells that are clicked will put the cell into edit mode or select the cell or its row. Depending on your application, you may want the user to edit any cell just by clicking on it, or you may want to require a separate action to trigger cell editing, such as double-clicking or a keystroke combination. Similarly, you can choose whether cells should be individually selectable, or if selecting the row is a sufficient response to clicking on a cell.

Note that how selection behaves on the client side depends heavily on the capabilities of the browser. In downlevel browsers, the grid will be renedred using standard HTML, and HTML selection rules will apply.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.CellPadding
member.summary: The amount of cell padding used in cells of the band.
member.remarks: Cell padding is the amount of white space between the borders of the cell and the cell's contents. To specify the amount of space separating cells from one another, use CellSpacing.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.CellPaddingResolved
member.summary: The amount of cell padding used in cells of the band. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the band.

remarks.p: Cell padding is controlled by the property. However, if a band is a child of another band, CellPadding may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the parent band. If the parent band is a child of another band, it may also be inheriting a value for this property, so its own CellPadding property would also be set to the "use deafult" setting. Even if the band is a top-level band, CellPadding may be set to its "use default" value, which means the value used is the preset one built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out the amount of cell padding used in the current band, use the CellPaddingResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you how much padding is being applied to cells in the band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.CellSpacing
member.summary: The amount of cell spacing to use in the cells of the band.
member.remarks: Cell spacing is the amount of space separating cells from one another. To specify the amount of white space between the borders of the cell and the cell's contents, use CellPadding.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.CellSpacingResolved
member.summary: The amount of cell spacing used in cells of the band. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the band.

remarks.p: Cell spacing is controlled by the property. However, if a band is a child of another band, CellSpacing may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the parent band. If the parent band is a child of another band, it may also be inheriting a value for this property, so its own CellSpacing property would also be set to the "use deafult" setting. Even if the band is a top-level band, CellSpacing may be set to its "use default" value, which means the value used is the preset one built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out the amount of cell spacing used in the current band, use the CellSpacingResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you how much spacing is being applied between cells in the band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.AllowRowNumbering
member.summary: Gets/sets whether the UltraWebGrid will render row numbers and which schema will be used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.AllowRowNumberingResolved
member.summary: Determines whether the UltraWebGrid will render out row numbers and which schema it will render them by.

remarks.p: Row Numbering is controlled by the property. However, if a band is a child of another band, AllowRowNumbering may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the parent band. If the parent band is a child of another band, it may also be inheriting a value for this property, so its own AllowRowNumbering property would also be set to the "use default" setting. Even if the band is a top-level band, AllowRowNumbering may be set to its "use default" value, which means the value used is the preset one built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out whether the UltraWebGrid will use Row Numbering in the current band, use the AllowRowNumberingResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you whether row numbering will be used on the band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.AllowUpdate
member.summary: Determines whether the user is allowed to update data.
member.remarks: This property determines whether to permit changes to the data displayed in the band or the grid. All data entry functionality is disabled when AllowUpdate is set to False. Cell contents cannot be edited. Users can still view data, select all or part of it and copy it to the clipboard. They can also re-arrange the layout of the grid by moving and resizing columns, groups, rows, etc. (provided these features are not also disabled using the appropriate properties.)

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.AllowUpdateResolved
member.summary: Determines whether the user is allowed to update data. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the band.

remarks.p: Record updating is controlled by the property. However, if a band is a child of another band, AllowUpdate may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the parent band. If the parent band is a child of another band, it may also be inheriting a value for this property, so its own AllowUpdate property would also be set to the "use deafult" setting. Even if the band is a top-level band, AllowUpdate may be set to its "use default" value, which means the value used is the preset one built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out whether data can be updated in the current band, use the AllowUpdateResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you whether record updating is allowed for the band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.AllowSorting
member.summary: Specifies whether the user can sort columns.
member.remarks: This property determines whehter the user can sort the data in the band based on the values present in a column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.AllowSortingResolved
member.summary: Specifies whether the user can sort columns. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the band.

remarks.p: Column sizing is controlled by the property. However, if a band is a child of another band, AllowSorting may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the parent band. If the parent band is a child of another band, it may also be inheriting a value for this property, so its own AllowSorting property would also be set to the "use deafult" setting. Even if the band is a top-level band, AllowSorting may be set to its "use default" value, which means the value used is the preset one built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out whether data can be sorted in the current band, use the AllowSortingResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you whether data sorting is allowed for the band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.AllowColSizing
member.summary: Determines whether the user is allowed to change the width of columns.
member.remarks: The AllowColSizing property specifies how column resizing will be handled in the band. When AllowColSizing is set to AllowSizing.Fixed, no resizing is allowed. When AllowColSizing is set to AllowSizing.Free, columns can be resized on the client. Setting the DisplayLayout.TableLayout property to TableLayout.Fixed provides ability to resize columns regardless of the data that is inside their cells. If the property is set to TableLayout.Auto, columns can be resized only within the free space, that is not occupied by cells' data.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.AllowColSizingResolved
member.summary: Determines whether the user is allowed to change the width of columns. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the band.

remarks.p: Column sizing is controlled by the property. However, if a band is a child of another band, AllowColSizing may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the parent band. If the parent band is a child of another band, it may also be inheriting a value for this property, so its own AllowColSizing property would also be set to the "use deafult" setting. Even if the band is a top-level band, AllowColSizing may be set to its "use default" value, which means the value used is the preset one built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out whether columns can be resized in the current band, use the AllowColSizingResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you whether column sizing is allowed for the band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.RowSizing
member.summary: Specifies whether and how the user can change the height of the rows.

remarks.p: The RowSizing property specifies whether the user can resize rows using the mouse in the band or the grid.

member.summary: Specifies whether and how the user can change the height of the rows. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the band.

remarks.p: Row sizing is controlled by the property. However, if a band is a child of another band, RowSizing may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the parent band. If the parent band is a child of another band, it may also be inheriting a value for this property, so its own RowSizing property would also be set to the "use deafult" setting. Even if the band is a top-level band, RowSizing may be set to its "use default" value, which means the value used is the preset one built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out whether row sizing is enabled in the current band, use the RowSizingResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you how row sizing is being applied in the band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.FooterStyle
member.summary: The default style that will be appplied to column footers in the band.

remarks.p: This property specifies a default style that will be applied to all the column footers in the band. The style may be overridden by the individual object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.HasFooterStyle
member.summary: Determines if a style has been applied to the column footers at the band level.

remarks.p: Returns True if a style for the column footers has been specifically set at the band level (through the property.) If False, the column footer style will be inherited (or taken from the overriding property of the UltraGridColumn object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.GridLines
member.summary: Specifies which cell borders should be shown in the band.
member.remarks: Use this property to quickly format the display of the lines separating the cells in the grid. You can choose to show horizontal lines, vertical lines, both or neither. In order for the borders to be visible, the RowStyle property must have settings that make it visible: such as, BorderStyle, BorderWidth, BorderColor.

member.summary: Specifies which cell borders should be shown in the band. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the band.

remarks.p: The display of lines in the grid is controlled by the property. However, if a band is a child of another band, GridLines may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the parent band. If the parent band is a child of another band, it may also be inheriting a value for this property, so its own GridLines property would also be set to the "use deafult" setting. Even if the band is a top-level band, GridLines may be set to its "use default" value, which means the value used is the preset one built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find how grid lines are displayed the current band, use the GridLinesResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you how grid lines are displayed in the band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.GroupByRowDescriptionMask
member.summary: A string that determines what text be shown in GroupBy rows. It can include special substitution strings (e.g. to specify child row count).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.GroupByRowDescriptionMaskResolved
member.summary: A string that determines what text be shown in GroupBy rows. It can include special substitution strings (e.g. to specify child row count). This property will always return the setting that is in control of the band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.NullText
member.summary: Specifies how null values will be represented in the grid.

remarks.p: This property specifies a string value that will be displayed in a grid cell whenever a null value is received for that cell from the back end. The default setting is to use an empty string (""). However, you can specify any string you want, such as the words "null" or "empty".

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.NullTextResolved
member.summary: Specifies how null values will be represented in the grid. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.ParentBand
member.summary: Returns the UltraGridBand object for the parent of the current band (if it is a child band) or Null for band 0. This property is read-only.

remarks.p: This property is useful for accessing the settings of properties of the parent band of the current band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.BaseTableName

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.ChildBandColumn
member.summary: Returns or sets a column name that is to be used in the DataBind

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.FormulaErrorStyle
member.summary: A GridItemStyle object that contains the style properties applied to column cells at the band level containing UltraCalc formula errors.

remarks.p: The FormulaErrorStyle property is used to specify the visual formatting of the cells in a calculated formula within any calculated column of this band having resulted in a formula error.
This property has no effect on the grid for non-calculated columns (i.e., the column has no formula defined).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.HasFormulaErrorStyle
member.summary: Determines if a style has been applied to the cells at a band level for use when their UltraCalc formula results in an error.

remarks.p: Returns True if a style for cells in this band has been specified in the event their column's UltraCalc formula results in an error. If False, the cells' formula error style will be inherited from the DisplayLayout if not overriden.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.RowEditTemplate
member.summary: Returns or sets the template that will be used with the rows in the band.

remarks.p: Use this property to assign a row editing template to the rows in the band or to access the properties of the template assigned to the band's rows.

Row templates can be used to provide an alternative to entering data directly into the grid. A template is a set of controls for the user to use when entering or viewing row data. The template appears as a sub-form with edit controls corresponding to the cells in the row, which are populated with row data when the template is displayed. The template can also display any other interface elements the developer deems appropriate. After the user has edited the row data using the controls of the template, they can dismiss the template, optionally comitting the changed data back to the datasource. Any changes made in the template will be reflected in the grid.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.RowEditItem
member.summary: Container into which the editing template for a row is instantiated.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.RowExpandEffects
member.summary: This object encapsulates the Internet Explorer Transitions functionality that band's row edit template expose.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.HasRowExpandEffects
member.summary: Determines if any of expand effects were applied to the band's row edit template.

remarks.p: Returns True if any of the band's row edit template expand effects have been specifically set (through the property).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.RowTemplateStyle
member.summary: An object that contains the style properties for the row edit template in the band.

remarks.p: Use this property to provide a custom style for the band's row edit template. Common style attributes that can be adjusted include: forecolor, backcolor, font, and alignment. You can use different styles to provide a consistent look throughout your application, enhance the appearance of certain areas of the grid, or to call attention to important data.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.HasRowTemplateStyle
member.summary: Determines if a style has been applied to the row edit template at the band level.

remarks.p: Returns True if a style for the row edit template has been specifically set at the band level (through the property.) If False, the row edit template will be inherited (or taken from the overriding property of the UltraGridBand object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.BorderCollapse
member.summary: Defines whether the grid borders should collapse or not.

remarks.p: This property makes the grid's border to look as a single one on the joints.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.BorderCollapseResolved
member.summary: Returns a value that determines whether the grid borders should collapse or not.

remarks.p: The borders collapse is controled by the property. However, if a band is a child of another band, BorderCollapse may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the grid layout.

To simply find out whether border collapse is set in the current band, use the BorderCollapseResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you whether border collapse is set in the band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.AllowColumnMoving
member.summary: Turns on the ability of moving columns on the server or on the client side.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.AllowColumnMovingResolved
member.summary: Turns on the ability of moving columns on the server or on the client side. Resolves value considering inheritance from the layout object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.FixedHeaderIndicator
member.summary: Specifies whether the user is allowed to fix/unfix the header on the client.

remarks.p: Setting the property to the Button value will enable the user's ability to fix or unfix the header dynamically on the client.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.FixedHeaderIndicatorResolved
member.summary: Specifies whether a column header is allowed to be fixed or unfixed by the user. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the column.

remarks.p: Whether the user is allowed to fix/unfix columns is controlled by the property. However, FixedHeaderIndicator may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the preset value built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out if the user is allowed to fix the column manually, use the FixedHeaderIndicatorResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you if the user is allowed to fix/unfix the column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.FixedCellStyle
member.summary: The style that will be applied to cells in the fixed column of the band. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual columns.

remarks.p: This property specifies a style that will be applied to all cells in the fixed columns in the band. The style may be overridden by the individual object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.FixedHeaderStyle

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridBand.ViewState
member.summary: Gets a dictionary of state information (StateBag) that allows you to save and restore the view state of a server control across multiple requests for the same page.

remarks.p: A server control's view state is the accumulation of all its property values. In order to preserve these values across HTTP requests, ASP.NET server controls use this property, which is an instance of the StateBag class, to store the property values. The values are then passed as a variable to an HTML hidden input element when subsequent requests are processed. For more information about saving server control view state, see Maintaining State in a Control.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridCell
member.summary: This class represents a cell in the grid (a specific column in a specific row).

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridCell.#ctor
member.summary: The UltraGridCell object represents a cell in the grid (a specific column in a specific row.)

remarks.p: The UltraGridCell object represents to an individual data cell in the grid. A cell corresponds to a single field within a single record of the data source. Cells represent the atomic unit for accessing and formatting data, and occupy the lowest level of the data hierarchy, following rows, bands and the grid itself. Despite this, cells provide a lot of functionality, and the ability to work with data at a very fine level.

UltraGridCell objects change state in response to user interactions with the grid. Aside from simply displaying data, a cell can be selected, activated or in put into edit mode. There are properties that deal with each of these states, giving you control over cells under any circumstance.

While you can control the appearance and (to some extent) the behavior of individual cells, more often you will want to work with cells in aggregate, either as members of a column or a row. Both the UltraGridColumn object and the UltraGridRow object have multiple properties specifically for formatting the cells that they contain. For example, the UltraGridColumn object determines the type of input and display capabilities a cell has - whether it appears as a button, check box, dropdown combo, etc.

member.summary: Returns a string representation of an object.

remarks.p: Some objects do not have values that can be converted to a string. In these cases, an empty string is returned.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridCell.Activate
member.summary: Sets the current cell as the active cell.

remarks.p: Only one cell in the grid at a time may be the active cell. The active cell is the one that receives the input focus. If a cell is being edited, that cell is automatically the active cell. However, a cell may also be active without being in edit mode.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridCell.GetText
member.summary: Returns the text of the cell taking into account any data masking that has been applied.

remarks.p: The string value returned by this method includes any data formatting or masking that has been applied to a cell. So for example, if a number has been formatted as a telephone number, this method will return a string that includes the parentheses and dashes shown in the number.

member.summary: Shows if the cell is editable.

member.summary: Indicates whether this cell is the active cell.
member.p: Only one cell in the grid may be active at any given time. When a cell becomes the active cell, its Activated property is set to True.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridCell.Band
member.summary: Returns the UltraGridBand object of the band that contains the cell.

remarks.p: The Band property of an object refers to a specific band in the grid as defined by an UltraGridBand object. You use the Band property to access the properties of a specified UltraGridBand object, or to return a reference to the UltraGridBand object that is associated with the current object.
UltraGridBand objects are the foundation of the hierarchical data structure used by UltraWebGrid. An UltraGridBand object is used to display all the data rows from a single level of a data hierarchy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridCell.Column
member.summary: Returns the UltraGridColumn object of the column that this cell belongs to.

remarks.p: The Column property of an object refers to a specific column in the band as defined by an UltraGridColumn object. You use the Column property to access the properties of a specified UltraGridColumn object, or to return a reference to the UltraGridColumn object that is associated with the current object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridCell.DataChanged
member.summary: Indicates whether the cell's data has been edited and not yet committed to the database

remarks.p: When the value of a cell is changed by user interaction, this property is set to True and the and events are generated. Note that the cell's new value is not necessarily committed to the data source at this time, however, since various factors such as the type of record locking employed by the data source, as well as the value of the property, can affect how the actual update occurs. Once the data source is actually updated, this property is set back to False.

member.summary: Unique string identifier for this Cell within the Cells collection

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridCell.TargetURL
member.summary: Sets the target URL for the cell.

remarks.p:
This property allows to set a URL for individual cells. If the property is set the cell text is rendered as a hyperlink. Preceding the URL with the '@' sign will open the referenced page in a new browser window. Preceding the URL with @[targetframe] will open the referenced page in the frame which name is 'targetframe'. The name of the frame is rendered into the TARGET attribute of the hyperlink so it can be any default frame name supported by the browser: _blank, _top, etc.
Example:
http://www.infragistics.com/ - opens the page in the current frame.
@http://www.infragistics.com/ or @[_blank]http://www.infragistics.com/ - opens the page in a new browser's window.
@[main]http://www.infragistics.com/ - opens the page in the frame named 'main'.
If the cell's column's type is Button or CheckBox the property setting is ignored.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ClientSideEvents.#ctor
member.summary: The default public constructor for the ClientSideEvents object. This object is created automatically by the UltraWebGrid control.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ClientSideEvents.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of an object.

remarks.p: Some objects do not have values that can be converted to a string. In these cases, an empty string is returned.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ClientSideEvents.CopyFrom(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ClientSideEvents)
member.summary: Copies the ClientSideEvents object

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ClientSideEvents.AfterRowUpdateHandler
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the name of the JavaScript function to be called after a row has been updated on the client.

remarks.p: The name of the JavaScript function can be user defined or native. For example, to specify that the native function alert should be called, this property could be set to "alert('hello')." To specify that a user-defined function, myFunction, should be called, this property would be set to "myFunction."
A user-defined function must be defined either inline or in a linked JavaScript (.JS) file and can accept the following parameters:

dd.p: String. The HTML element ID of the grid calling the function.
String. The HTML element ID of the row that was updated.

remarks.p: The parameters above are optional and can be named as desired.
For more information about using the class, please see the Client-Side Object Model.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ClientSideEvents.BeforeCellUpdateHandler
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the name of the JavaScript function to be called before a cell is updated on the client.

To specify that a user-defined function, myFunction, should be called, this property would be set to "myFunction."
A user-defined function must be defined either inline or in a linked JavaScript (.JS) file and can accept the following parameters:

dd.p: String. The HTML element ID of the grid calling the function.
String. The HTML element ID of the cell being edited.
String. The new value of the cell.

remarks.p: The parameters above are optional and can be named as desired.
The specified function can return True, to cancel the value change. At the same time a new value can be set using setValue off the cell CSOM object.
For more information about using the class, please see the Client-Side Object Model.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn
member.summary: The Column object contains the properties and methods that control the look and behavior of a vertical column of cells within UltraWebGrid.

remarks.p: A set of columns in combination with a set of rows comprises a table. When bound to a database, all cells of a column are populated with data from the same column of the database table.
All the cells of a particular column have certain characteristics in common: DataType, Editing format string, Column Selection type, and Column style.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an object that represents a single column of data.

remarks.p: An UltraGridColumn object represents a single column in the grid. The UltraGridColumn object is closely linked with a single underlying data field that is used to supply the data for all the cells in the column (except in the case of unbound columns, which have no underlying data field). The UltraGridColumn object determines what type of interface (edit, checkbox, dropdown list, etc.) will be used for individual cells, as well as controlling certain formatting and behavior-related settings, such as data masking, for the cells that make up the column. UltraGridColumns are also used when sorting grid data or setting up GroupBy mode, as they are the basic unit that provides the criteria needed for those features.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.DataType
member.summary: The Type of the column.
member.value: A string representation of the fully-qualified Type.

remarks.p: This is a fully-qualified Type name that includes the Common Language namespace. It is similar to what would be returned by the FullName property within the .NET Framework. This property does not contain assembly reference information. It therefore cannot disambiguate between versions of the same Type, or Types with identical full names.
All UltraGridColumns default to the type System.String, if no other DataType is specified or inferred.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.Tag
member.summary: A field for storing user-defined, object-related information. Objects assigned to this property must be serializable if ViewState is in effect.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.Band
member.summary: Returns the UltraGridBand object of the band that contains the column.

remarks.p: The Band property of an object refers to a specific band in the grid as defined by an UltraGridBand object. You use the Band property to access the properties of a specified UltraGridBand object, or to return a reference to the UltraGridBand object that is associated with the current object.
UltraGridBand objects are the foundation of the hierarchical data structure used by UltraWebGrid. An UltraGridBand object is used to display all the data rows from a single level of a data hierarchy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.CellMultiline
member.summary: Determines if the cells of the column will edit text as a multiline textarea.

remarks.p:
When set to Yes, editing for the cell will take place within a textarea control that allows the Enter key to insert newline characters. When edit mode is terminated, the cells are formatted with
tags to indicate the newline placement.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.AllowGroupBy
member.summary: Determines whether the column can be dragged into the GroupByBox and used to group rows.

remarks.p: If this property is set to True, the column can be used to organize the rows of the band in GroupBy mode. If False, this column cannot be used to group the rows of the band, and the column header cannot be dragged into the GroupBy box.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.DefaultValue
member.summary: Default value used for cells in this column when a new row is added.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.AllowResize
member.summary: Determines whether a column can be resized and the type of resizing that is permitted.

remarks.p: You can use this property to specify how the column should be resized. The column can either be fixed (no resizing), free (resizing allowed) or not set, in which case the value that determines whether resizing is possible will be inherited. The default value is "NotSet".
If this propert is set to "NotSet" you can use the property to determin the value that is being used to control the resizing of the column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.AllowResizeResolved
member.summary: Determines whether a column can be resized and the type of resizing that is permitted. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the column.

remarks.p: The resizing of columns is controlled by the property. However, AllowResize may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the band containing the column, the parent band of the band containng the column, or from the preset value built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out whether column resizing is allowed for the current column, use the AllowResizeResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you if column resizing is premitted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.HeaderClickAction
member.summary: Specifies what will occur when the user clicks on a column header.

remarks.p: The default action for a column header is to select the column when clicked. You can also choose to make clicking a column header sort the band based on the contents of the one column, or add the column to the ones being used to sort the band data.

When this property is set to HeaderClickAction.SortMultiple, the user can use the CTRL key in combination with the mouse to select multiple columns for sorting. The order in which columns are selected is significant, determining the order in which the data will be sorted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.HeaderClickActionResolved
member.summary: Specifies how a column header should react to being clicked. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the column.

remarks.p: The action that occurs when a column header is clicked is controlled by the property. However, HeaderClickAction may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the band containing the column, the parent band of the band containng the column, or from the preset value built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out what action will occur when the header of the current column is clicked, use the HeaderClickActionResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you what action will be triggered by clicking the column header.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.Case
member.summary: Returns or sets the case to use when editing or displaying column text.

remarks.p: This property specifies whether the column should display text in a specific case and change the case of the text being edited. This property actually changes the case of edited text; if you set Case to a non-zero value, any text you edit or enter will be stored in the database as either all uppercase or all lowercase. Note that while the text is displayed using the specified case, the changed case text is not committed back into the database unless a change is made to the value of the cell. Simply placing the cell into edit mode will not change the data to the displayed case.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.Type
member.summary: The type of column that will be rendered.

remarks.p: This property specifies what type of cell will be used to display and input data for the column. Available types include button, checkbox, and hyperlink.

The setting of this property for a column may affect other aspects of the control's operation. For example, using one of the dropdown styles requires the property of the column to be set in order to fill the dropdown list with text. Setting this property to one of the button styles will cause the control to fire the event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.BaseColumnName
member.summary: Returns the name of the field in the data store on which the column is based.

remarks.p: If the column is bound to a data source, this property returns the name of the underlying data field that is supplying data for the column. If the column is unbound, this property returns Null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.FieldLen
member.summary: Maximum field length permitted when editing cells within this column.

remarks.p: In addition to acting as a constraint during editing, when cells are rendered back to the user after a postback, content placed into the cells may be truncated to the specified FieldLen if it exceeds this limit.
By default, this constraint is turned off (with the value 0), and cells may have any field length.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.FooterStyle
member.summary: An object that contains the style properties for the footer section of the column.

remarks.p: Use this property to provide a custom style for the footer section fo the column. Common style attributes that can be adjusted include: forecolor, backcolor, font, and alignment. You can use different styles to provide a consistent look throughout your application, enhance the appearance of certain areas of the grid, or to call attention to important data.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.HasFooterStyle
member.summary: Determines if a style has been applied to the column footers.

remarks.p: Returns True if a style for the column footers has been specifically set (through the property.) If False, the column footer style will be inherited.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.FooterStyleResolved
member.summary: An object that contains the style properties for the column footer. This object represents the actual visible state of the column footer.

remarks.p: The appearance of the column footer is controlled by the GridItemStyle object specified by the property. However, only some appearance-related properties may be controlled by that object, while others are intherited from other areas of the grid. For example, rows inherit their appearance from the band. If you use the UltraGridStyle object for rows just to change their text alignment, the foreground and background color will still be intherited from the band. The values for foreground and background color will not be set in the UltraGridStyle object for the rows.

You can use the FooterStyleResolved property to determine all the formatting attributes that are being applied to an object, regardless of inheritance issues. This property returns an GridItemStyle object with all of its attributes set to the values that are being used to control the formatting of the object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.FooterText
member.summary: The text displayed in the footer section of the column.
member.remarks: Use the FooterText property to specify or determine the text displayed in the footer section of the column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.FooterTotal
member.summary: Specifies the type of summary information to display in the column footer. Text, Sum, Average, Minimum, Maximum and Count are available.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.CellButtonDisplay
member.summary: Determines how cell buttons will be displayed in the column.

remarks.p: If the column is set to display cell buttons, the CellButtonDisplay property determines how the visibility of the buttons will be handled. Cell buttons can be displayed at all times, or only in response to the mouse pointer entering the cell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.CellButtonStyle
member.summary: An object that contains the style properties for the cell buttons of the column.
member.remarks: Use this property to provide a custom style for the column's cell buttons. Common style attributes that can be adjusted include: forecolor, backcolor, font, and alignment. You can use differnt styles to provide a consistent look throughout your application, enhance the appearance of certain areas of the grid, or to call attention to important data.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.HeaderStyle
member.summary: An UltraWebStyle object that contains the style properties for the header section of the column.
member.remarks: Use this property to provide a custom style for the header section of the column. Common style attributes that can be adjusted, include forecolor, backcolor, font, and content alignment within the cell. Providing a different style enhances the appearance of the column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.SelectedHeaderStyle
member.summary: An object that contains the style properties for the selected column header.

remarks.p: Use this property to provide a custom style for the column header when the column has been selected. Common style attributes that can be adjusted include: forecolor, backcolor, font, and alignment. You can use different styles to provide a consistent look throughout your application, enhance the appearance of certain areas of the grid, or to call attention to important data.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.HeaderText
member.summary: The text that appears in the header of the column.

remarks.p: This property specifies the text of the column's header. By default, the column's header displays the name of the field from the data source to which the column is bound.

member.summary: Determines whether a column is hidden from view

member.summary: Determines whether a column will be rendered down to the client

member.summary: Index in the Columns collection

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.IsGroupByColumn
member.summary: True - insert this column into the Band's SortedColumns collection after all existing groupby columns and before any sorted columns that are not Groupbys. The rows that have common values for this column will then be grouped together under a single GroupBy row along with an expansion indicator.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.Format
member.summary: A string used to control the formatting of displayed text.

remarks.p: The Format property is similar to the Format function, and supports all of the named arguments and literal strings supported by that function.
The Format property applies only to cells that are not in edit mode.

member.summary: Determines whether the column is selected

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.SortIndicator
member.summary: The convenience variable stored for the sorted order of the column. Setting this property will NOT sort the column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.ValueList
member.summary: A list of values that are to be contained in a combo box portion of a column with a combo box style

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.HasValueList
member.summary: Determines if the column has a value list attached.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.NullText
member.summary: The string displayed in cells with null values.

remarks.p: You can use this property to customize the text displayed to the user when a null value is present in a cell. For example, you may want the cell to display "(empty)" or "no value". The default setting for this property is "null".

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.NullTextResolved
member.summary: The string displayed in cells with null values. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the column.

remarks.p: The text displayed for null value cells is controlled by the property. However, NullText may be set to inherit its value from the band containing the column, the parent band of the band containng the column, or from the preset value built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out what string is being displayed when the current column contains a null value, use the NullTextResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns the text string that will be used.

members.member:
The width of the column, in pixels.
The browser will actually treat this setting as a recommendation unless the DisplayLayout.TableLayout property is set to TableLayout.Fixed. remarks>

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.WidthResolved
member.summary: The width of the column, in pixels. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the column.

remarks.p: The width of columns is controlled by the property. However, Width may be inherited from the band containing the column, or from the ColWidthDefault value of the DisplayLayout.
To simply find out the width of the current column, use the WidthResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns the column's width.
The browser will actually treat this setting as a recommendation unless the DisplayLayout.TableLayout properter is set to TableLayou.Fixed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.CellStyle
member.summary: An object that contains the style properties for the cells of the column.

remarks.p: Use this property to provide a custom style for the column's cells. Common style attributes that can be adjusted include: forecolor, backcolor, font, and alignment. You can use differnt styles to provide a consistent look throughout your application, enhance the appearance of certain areas of the grid, or to call attention to important data.
This setting wil override any style applied at the band level. This setting may be overidden by any style applied at the cell level.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.AllowUpdate
member.summary: Determines whether the values of the column may be updated.

remarks.p: This property controls the updating for individaul columns. There is also a band-level setting for which determines whether any of the columns in the band may be updated. The setting of the band-level property will override the setting of the column-level property for any columns in the band.

members.member:
Determines whether the values of the column may be updated. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the column.
The updating of columns is controlled by the property. However, AllowUpdate may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the band containing the column, the parent band of the band containng the column, or from the preset value built into the UltraWebGrid.
To simply find out whether column resizing is allowed for the current column, use the AllowResizeResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you if column resizing is premitted.

member.summary: Allows having null values in the column.

remarks.p: This property permits to have null values in the column. The null value is assigned when user clears the cell. Visible value is taken from the NullText property.
This property influence the client side behavior only. If a cell had a null value initially it is kept as is regardless of the property value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.EditorControlID
member.summary: A control's ID that is used to edit the cells in the column.

member.summary: Allows to apply the cells fore color to the links in the column.

remarks.p: If set to true the fore color of the cells text is applied to the links in the column. By default the links color is taken from the body settings.

member.summary: The ColumnHeader object describing the header properties of this column.

member.summary: Determines if a header has been created on the column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.Footer
member.summary: The ColumnFooter object that describes the footer properties of this column.

remarks.p: Developers use this property to alter the appearance and/or behavior of the column's footer after they have enabled footers by setting the ColFootersVisible on this column's (or the ColFootersVisibleDefault on the grid's DisplayLayout) to ShowMarginInfo.Yes.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.HasFooter
member.summary: Determines if a footer has been created on the column.

remarks.p: Returns True if the column's footer has been explicitly set through the property. If False, the column's footer has default settings.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.ViewState
member.summary: Gets a dictionary of state information (StateBag) that allows you to save and restore the view state of a server control across multiple requests for the same page.

remarks.p: A server control's view state is the accumulation of all its property values. In order to preserve these values across HTTP requests, ASP.NET server controls use this property, which is an instance of the StateBag class, to store the property values. The values are then passed as a variable to an HTML hidden input element when subsequent requests are processed. For more information about saving server control view state, see Maintaining State in a Control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.Formula
member.summary: Specifies the UltraCalc formula.

remarks.p: The property must be set to a valid implementation of for the calculation engine to initialize itself, create a calculation network, and evaluate the contents of this property. When a CalcManager is not in place, settings to this property shall have no effect.
When a syntactically-correct formula has been assigned, the values stored in cells for this column reflect computed results instead of direct databound values.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.FormulaErrorStyle
member.summary: A GridItemStyle object that contains the style properties applied to cells within the column containing UltraCalc formula errors.

remarks.p: The FormulaErrorStyle property is used to specify the visual formatting of the cells in a calculated formula (one in which is non-null and non-empty) having resulted in a formula error.
This property has no effect on the grid if this column is not an UltraCalc-calculated column (i.e., it has no formula defined).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.HasFormulaErrorStyle
member.summary: Determines if a style has been applied to the column's cells for use when their UltraCalc formula results in an error.

remarks.p: Returns True if a style for the column's cells has been specified (through the property) for when their UltraCalc formula calculation results in an error. If False, the cells' formula error style will be inherited from their Band or (if not specified at the band-level) DisplayLayout.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.FormulaErrorStyleResolved
member.summary: A GridItemStyle object that contains the style properties for the column when it's cells result in an UltraCalc formula error. This object represents the actual visible state of those cells in error.

remarks.p: The appearance of the column cells evaluating to an error when their values are calculated by UltraCalc is controlled by the GridItemStyle object specified in the property. However, only some appearance-related properties may be controlled by this object, while others are intherited from other styles defined on the grid. For example, rows always inherit their appearance from the band. If you use the GridItemStyle object for rows just to change their text alignment, the foreground and background color will still be intherited from the band. The values for foreground and background color will not be explicitly set in the GridItemStyle for the rows.

You can use the FormulaErrorStyleResolved property to determine every formatting attribute that is going to be rendered for an object, regardless of inheritance issues. This property returns a GridItemStyle object with all of its attributes set to the inherited values that are being used to control the rendering of the object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn.FormulaErrorValue
member.summary: Specifies the value to assign to the data source if the column's formula evaluates to an error.

remarks.p: If this column doesn't have set, this property is ignored.
