member.summary: Resets Formula property to it's default value of null.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ColumnFooter.ShouldSerializeFormula
member.summary: Indicates whether the Formula property has changed from the default value.
member.returns: True if the should be serialized because it has changed from its default value, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ColumnFooter.Formula
member.summary: Specifies an UltraCalc formula for calculating the summary of this column's footer.
member.value: A string representing a formula of one or more references and optionally built-in and/or user-defined functions in UltraCalc expression syntax.

remarks.p: The property must be set to Formula and the must be set to a valid instance of for this property to have any affect.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ColumnFooter.FormulaErrorStyle
member.summary: A GridItemStyle object that contains the style properties applied to values within the column footer resulting from an UltraCalc formula error.

remarks.p: The FormulaErrorStyle property is used to specify the visual formatting of the footer with a calculated formula (one in which is non-null and non-empty) having resulted in a formula error.
This property has no effect on the grid if this column footer is not an UltraCalc-calculated column footer (i.e., it has no formula defined and is something other than Formula).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ColumnFooter.HasFormulaErrorStyle
member.summary: Determines if a style has been applied to the column's footer value for use when the UltraCalc formula results in an error.

remarks.p: Returns True if a style for the column's footer value has been specified (through the property) for when the UltraCalc formula calculation results in an error. If False, the footer's formula error style will be inherited from it's Column, Band (if not specified at the column-level) or (if not specified at the column- or band-levels) DisplayLayout.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ColumnFooter.FormulaErrorStyleResolved
member.summary: A GridItemStyle object that contains the style properties for the column footer when it's value result from an UltraCalc formula is an error. This object represents the actual visible state of the footer value in error.

remarks.p: The appearance of the column footers evaluating to an error when its value is calculated by UltraCalc is controlled by the GridItemStyle object specified in the property. However, only some appearance-related properties may be controlled by this object, while others are inherited from other styles defined on the grid. For example, rows always inherit their appearance from the band. If you use the GridItemStyle object for rows just to change their text alignment, the foreground and background color will still be inherited from the band. The values for foreground and background color will not be explicitly set in the GridItemStyle for the rows.

You can use the FormulaErrorStyleResolved property to determine every formatting attribute that is going to be rendered for an object, regardless of inheritance issues. This property returns a GridItemStyle object with all of its attributes set to the inherited values that are being used to control the rendering of the object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ColumnFooter.Infragistics#WebUI#CalcEngine#IFormulaProvider#CalcManager
member.summary: Gets the IUltraCalcManager implementation associated with this participant.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ColumnFooter.Infragistics#WebUI#CalcEngine#IFormulaProvider#Participant
member.summary: Gets the participating formula provider for this column footer.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ColumnFooter.Infragistics#WebUI#CalcEngine#IFormulaProvider#Reference
member.summary: Gets the IUltraCalcReference implementation for this participant.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ColumnFooter.Total
member.summary: Specifies the type and calculation method of summary information to display in this column's footer.

remarks.p: Possible types of summary information that can appear in a footer include: Text, Sum, Average, Minimum, Maximum, Count and Formula. The default setting is Text, which displays literal text in the footer.
Developers must set Total to Formula in order to have an UltraCalc formula calculated and displayed in the footer.

exception.p: Thrown when a value not defined by the SummaryInfo enumeration is assigned (for instance, an out-of-range integer value).

This exception sometimes arises in languages like VB.NET, where compile-time type-checking is weak, when casting a patently invalid value and attempting to assign it to this property, or from using an .aspx document created with a newer version of the UltraWebGrid element that contains an enhanced set of SummaryInfo values that are unavailable to an older version of the UltraWebGrid element built from a parsing of that .aspx document.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ColumnHeader
member.summary: Holds properties for the column's header. Inherited from HeaderBase

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ColumnHeader.CopyFrom(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ColumnHeader)
member.summary: Copies the ColumnHeader object

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ColumnHeader.ClickAction
member.summary: Specifies what will occur when the user clicks on a column header.

remarks.p: The default action for a column header is to select the column when clicked. You can also choose to make clicking a column header sort the band based on the contents of the one column, or add the column to the ones being used to sort the band data.

When this property is set to HeaderClickAction.SortMultiple, the user can use the CTRL key in combination with the mouse to select multiple columns for sorting. The order in which columns are selected is significant, determining the order in which the data will be sorted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ColumnHeader.ClickActionResolved
member.summary: Specifies how a column header should react to being clicked. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the column.

remarks.p: The action that occurs when a column header is clicked is controlled by the property. However, HeaderClickAction may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the band containing the column, the parent band of the band containng the column, or from the preset value built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out what action will occur when the header of the current column is clicked, use the HeaderClickActionResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you what action will be triggered by clicking the column header.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ColumnHeader.Fixed
member.summary: Specifies whether the header is fixed.

remarks.p: If the property is set to true the entire column the header belongs to will be fixed on the left side of the grid and not scrollable with the rest of the data. You must enable the fixed-headers functionality by setting UseFixedHeaders to true in order for this property to have any effect.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ColumnHeader.FixedHeaderIndicator
member.summary: Specifies whether the user is allowed to fix/unfix the header on the client.

remarks.p: Setting the property to the Button value will enable the user's ability to fix or unfix the header dynamically on the client.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ColumnHeader.FixedHeaderIndicatorResolved
member.summary: Specifies whether a column header is allowed to be fixed or unfixed by the user. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the column.

remarks.p: Whether the user is allowed to fix/unfix columns is controlled by the property. However, FixedHeaderIndicator may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the band containing the column, the parent band of the band containng the column, or from the preset value built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out if the user is allowed to fix the column manually, use the FixedHeaderIndicatorResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you if the user is allowed to fix/unfix the column.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.TemplatedColumn
member.summary: The TemplatedColumn class provides access to the template-specific features of the UltraGridColumn object. You can use this class to manage the header, footer and cell templates attached to any given column.
member.remarks: Each column can support three kinds of templates. Header templates apply to the column header and determine the text that will be displayed in the header and the image displayed for the sort indicator. Footer templates appy to the column footer and supply text and summary text for the footer. Cell templates are applied to each cell of the column, and offer the capability to provide a custom editing control layout on a cell-by-cell basis.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.TemplatedColumn.CopyFrom(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridColumn)
member.summary: Copies the template from the specified column to the current column. Header, footer and cell templates will be copied.
member.param: The templated column (UltraGridColumn object) from which you wish to copy the templates.
member.returns: The current column with the templates applied. If the passed-in column is not a templated column, the current column is returned unchanged.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.TemplatedColumn.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Returns or sets the template that will be used with the column header.

remarks.p: Use this property to assign a template to a column header or to access the properties of the template assigned to a column header. Column header templates can be used to specify the text and sort indicator image for a column header.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.TemplatedColumn.HeaderItem
member.summary: Returns or sets the HeaderItem associated with this column. The HeaderItem functions as the container into which the column header template is instantiated.

remarks.p: You can use this property to access the controls used by the header template for a given column. This property returns a collection of objects that correspond to the controls that make up the template. Use HeaderItem to access these controls and any children they may contain.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.TemplatedColumn.CellTemplate
member.summary: Returns or sets the template that will be used with the column's cells.

remarks.p: Use this property to assign a template to the cells of a column or to access the properties of the template assigned to a column's cells.

Cell templates can be used to provide an alternative to entering data directly into the cell. A template is a set of controls for the user to use when entering or viewing data. The template appears as a sub-form with at least one editable control (text box, drop-down list, set of option buttons, etc.) corresponding to the value of the cell. The template is updated with the value from the cell when it is displayed. The template can also display any other interface elements the developer deems appropriate. After the user has edited the cell data using the controls of the template, they can dismiss the template, optionally comitting the changed data. Any changes made in the template will be reflected in the grid.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.TemplatedColumn.CellItems
member.summary: Returns or sets the collection of CellItems associated with this column. The CellItem functions as the container into which the Cell templates are instantiated.

remarks.p: You can use this property to access the controls used by the Cell templates for a given column. This property returns a collection of objects that correspond to the controls that make up the template. Use CellItem to access these controls and any children they may contain.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.TemplatedColumn.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Returns or sets the template that will be used with the column footer.

remarks.p: Use this property to assign a template to a column footer or to access the properties of the template assigned to a column footer. Column footer templates can be used to specify the label text and the summary text that appears in the column footer.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.TemplatedColumn.FooterItem
member.summary: Returns or sets the FooterItem associated with this column. The FooterItem functions as the container into which the cell footer template is instantiated.

remarks.p: You can use this property to access the controls used by the Footer template for a given column. This property returns a collection of objects that correspond to the controls that make up the template. Use FooterItem to access these controls and any children they may contain.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.LoadOnDemand
member.summary: Enumeration of the types of Load On Demand styles supported. These property settings control the methods used to load rows into the grid.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.LoadOnDemand.NotSet
member.summary: All rows are populated during a databind operation and expand images are only displayed for rows that have children.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.LoadOnDemand.Manual
member.summary: The developer is responsible for populating the rows of the grid. The application populates an initial set of rows. For those rows that may have children added later, the ShowExpand property needs to be set to true by the developer. The grid then renders the row with an expand image next to it. If the user clicks the expand image to expand the row, the DemandLoad event is fired on the server and the children of the node need to be populated by the developer. Using LoadOnDemand.Manual, it is necessary to have Band objects created for each level of Rows that may be expanded using plus (+) images. If there is no Band object for rows that may be expanded, the WebGrid will not display a plus sign next to rows in the parent Band.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.LoadOnDemand.Automatic
member.summary: The application databinds the grid using a dataset. Initially, only the rows at the top level of the hierarchy are added to the grid. All Band 0 rows with children in the dataset are rendered with the ShowExpand property set to true. When the user clicks a row expansion indicator, the page is posted back and the databind is performed again. This time, the row that was expanded is also populated from the dataset. No unexpanded rows are populated. Using the Automatic form of LoadOnDemand requires that DataBind() is called on each postback.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.RowNumbering
member.summary: Enumeration for the row numbering methodology used by the WebGrid.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.RowNumbering.NotSet
member.summary: Value is taken from higher level object.

member.summary: Row numbering will increment for each row ignoring band depth as a discriminator. In this mode, each row will receives a value that will be unique to the WebGrid.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.RowNumbering.ByDataIsland
member.summary: Row numbering will reset for each data island. Values in a data island will be unique, however values may be repeated in data islands which are at the same band depth but have different parent rows.

member.summary: Event arguments that are passed to event handlers for XmlHTTPRequests.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.XmlHTTPRequestEventArgs.Type
member.summary: Returns the type of request.
member.remarks: Properties that are used for different types: LoadChildRows - Band, RowNo and RowDataKey. The number and data key is for the row which child rows are being requested. LoadMoreRows - Band and RowNo. The band is always band 0. RowNo is the first row number that is being requested. Sort - Band and Column which is being sorted, Data is the shift key state, should be cast to bool. UpdateCell - Band, Column, RowNo, RowDataKey and Data. The column defines the cell in the row that is being edited. Data contains new cell value. AddNewRow - Band, RowNo and RowDataKey. Band is the band to which a row is being added, row number and data key are the parent row's number and data key, not defined if it's the top level. DeleteRow - Band, RowNo and RowDataKey.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.XmlHTTPRequestEventArgs.Band
member.summary: Returns the Band object associated with the event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.XmlHTTPRequestEventArgs.Column
member.summary: Returns the Column object associated with the event. If the request does not involve any column this property is null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.XmlHTTPRequestEventArgs.RowNo
member.summary: Returns the number of the row associated with the event. If the request does not involve any row this property is -1.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.XmlHTTPRequestEventArgs.RowDataKey
member.summary: Returns the data key of the row associated with the event. If the request does not involve any row or the data key cannot be determined this property is null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.XmlHTTPRequestEventArgs.Data
member.summary: Additional data associated with the request.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ActiveCellChangeEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate that handles the event, which is generated when the active cell is about to be changed.

remarks.p: This event occurs when the control must change the active cell, either due to user activity or in response to a directive in code, such as setting the property.
Note that changes to the active row may also cause the active cell to change. The delegate handles the event, which is generated when the active row is about to be changed.

member.param: A reference to the grid that generated the event.
A reference to the object containing additional information associated with the event.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.InitializeBandEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate that handles the event, which is generated when a band needs to be configured during data binding.

remarks.p: The delegate handles the event, which is generated when a band needs to be configured during data binding. Handling this event provides the opportunity to control further databinding to child bands. The ChildBandColumn property of the Band can be set to indicate which column name or relation name to use in the datasource for creating the rows of the child band. If "NoChildBand" is specified, the databinding will stop at the level of the current band even if child enumerations are present in the data source.

member.param: A reference to the grid that generated the event.
A reference to the object containing additional information associated with the event.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects
member.summary: This object encapsulates the Internet Explorer Transitions functionality that UltraWebGrid's expandable objects expose.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects.#ctor
member.summary: Returns a reference to the ExpandEffects object for the Grid control.

remarks.p: The ExpandEffects object encapsulates the settings of the expansion effects that can be applied to expandable objects. You can use this object to specify an effect such as Fade In, Iris, Slide, Gradient Wipe or Pixelate. This object also contains properties for controlling the effects that will be applied during the transition, such as delay and duration, and that will be applied to the expandable objects during and after the transition, such as opacity and drop shadow.

The transition effects applied to the expandable objects rely on the transition features built into Internet Explorer version 5 or greater. These settings are ignored in down-level browsers or any version of Netscape. The visual effects are also operating system dependant, and may not be available on all systems.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects.CopyFrom(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects)
member.summary: Applies the attributes of an existing ExpandEffects object to the current ExpandEffects object, using the property categories specified.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to copy some or all of an existing object's property settings to another object of the same type.

By default, all the properties of the object are copied. You can also specify that only certain categories of properties should be copied form the one object to the other. Multiple categories can be copied by combining them using logical Or.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects.Reset
member.summary: Resets all properties of the class to their default values.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to reset all properties of the Band class to their default values.
The "ShouldSerialize" properties of the ExpandEffects object will return False until set again.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the ExpandEffects object.

remarks.p: Some objects do not have values that can be converted to a string. In these cases, an empty string is returned. The ExpandEffects object will return an empty string.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects.Duration
member.summary: Specifies the amount of time elapsed in milliseconds between the beginning and the end of a transition effect.

remarks.p: This is the amount of time it takes the expand effect to occur. If is set to ExpandEffectsType.Notset, this setting has no effect.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects.Opacity
member.summary: Specifies the amount of transparency applied to the expandable object after the expand effect is complete.

remarks.p: This property specifies the opacity of the expandable object as a percentage. A setting of 100 is completely opaque, a setting of 0 is completely transparent (invisible). A setting in between these values will produce a partially visisble expandable object through which the contents of the page may be seen.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects.ShadowColor
member.summary: Specifies the color of the drop shadow that will appear under the expandable object.

remarks.p: Drop shadows provide an illusion of depth to expandable objects as they appear over the web page. You can specify the width of the drop shadow using the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects.ShadowWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width of the drop shadow that will appear under the expandable object.

remarks.p: Drop shadows provide an illusion of depth to expandable objects as they appear over the web page. Set this property to 0 to eliminate the drop shadow. You can specify the color of the drop shadow using the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects.Delay
member.summary: Specifies the amount of time elapsed before an expandable object will open up in response to a mouse click or a mouseover.

remarks.p: The default delay is 200 milliseconds. This property specifies the time that will elapse before the expand effect begins.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GridItemStyle
member.summary: The GridItemStyle class handles properties and methods directly related to the appearance of an object inside the grid. GridItemStyles are applied to the cells, footers and column headers of the grid.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GridItemStyle.IsEmpty
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value that determines whether a object is set to Nothing or Null.

remarks.p: True if the GridItemStyle object from which this method was invoked is set to Nothing or Null; otherwise, False.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GridItemStyle.Reset
member.summary: Resets all properties of the class to their default values.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to reset all properties of the GridItemStyle class to their default values.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GridItemStyle.CopyFrom(System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style)
member.summary: Duplicates the style properties of the specified Style into the instance of the Style class from which this method is invoked.

remarks.p: Use the CopyFrom method to duplicate the style properties of the specified Style into the instance of the Style class from which this method is invoked.
All properties in the current instance of the Style class will be replaced by their corresponding properties in the Style specified by the style parameter.

param.name: style
param.p: A Style object that represents the style to copy.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GridItemStyle.MergeWith(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GridItemStyle,System.String)
member.summary: Merges the style with the 'mergeStyle' style using 'styles' as the array of styles to merge separated with semicolon. Empty means CustomRules.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GridItemStyle.Merge(Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Style,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Replace properties of this by not-default properties of the s
member.param: Style which priorities have priority over properties of this
True: Reset this before merging.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GridItemStyle.Wrap
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether the text associated with a object is wrapped.

remarks.p: Set this property to True when the text associated with the GridItemStyle object should wrap from one line to the next when it does not fit.
Set this property to False (default) when the text associated the GridItemStyle object should not wrap.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GridItemStyle.HorizontalAlign
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the horizontal alignment of the text associated with a object.

remarks.p: The Left setting horizontally aligns text at the left of the object.
The Center setting horizontally centers text in the object.
The Right setting horizontally aligns text at the right of the object.
The Justify setting horizontally aligns text so that text is aligned at both the left and the right of the object.
The property is used to align text vertically.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GridItemStyle.VerticalAlign
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the vertical alignment of the text associated with a object.

remarks.p: The Bottom setting vertically aligns text at the bottom of the object.
The Middle setting vertically centers text in the object.
The Top setting vertically aligns text at the top of the object.
The property is used to align text horizontally.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GridItemStyle.TextOverflow
member.summary: Defines text's behavior in a nowrap-mode (Internet Explorer 6 and above only).

member.summary: This method supports the Infragistics control infrastructure, and is not intended for use by application code.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GroupByBox
member.summary: The GroupByBox object represents the area at the top of the grid that is used for dragging or clicking column headers in order to group rows by the common values of that column.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GroupByBox.Reset
member.summary: Resets all properties of the class to their default values.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to reset all properties of the GridItemStyle class to their default values.
The "ShouldSerialize" properties of the GridItemStyle will retun False until set again.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GroupByBox.CopyFrom(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.SpecialBoxBase)
member.summary: Duplicates the properties of the specified into the instance of the class from which this method is invoked.

remarks.p: Use the CopyFrom method to duplicate the properties of the specified SpecialBoxBase into the instance of the GroupByBox class from which this method is invoked.
All properties in the current instance of the SpecialBoxBase class will be replaced by their corresponding properties in the SpecialBoxBase object specified by the passin parameter.

param.name: source
param.p: A SpecialBoxBase object that represents the base box class to copy.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GroupByBox.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of a object.

remarks.p: Some objects do not have values that can be converted to a string. In these cases, an empty string is returned.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GroupByBox.Prompt
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that indicates to the user how to perform GroupBy operations.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is "Drag a column header here to group by that column."
The prompt will not be shown unless the property is set to OutlookGroupBy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GroupByBox.Location
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies where the band labels are rendered to the client.

remarks.p: The Top (default) setting renders the GroupByBox band labels above the grid on the client.
The Bottom setting renders the GroupByBox band labels below the grid on the client.
The band labels will not be shown unless the property is set to OutlookGroupBy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GroupByBox.BandLabelStyle
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets a object that determines how the band labels are rendered on the client.

remarks.p: Individual style attributes can be applied by setting the GridItemStyle object's corresponding properties. For example, a style's background color can be changed by setting its BackColor property.
A comprehensive pre-defined style can be applied by setting the GridItemStyle object's CssClass property to the name of the style.
The band labels will not be shown unless the property is set to OutlookGroupBy and the property is set to a value other than None.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GroupByBox.HasBandLabelStyle
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value that determines whether the property is currently set to a object.

remarks.p: This property returns True if the BandLabelStyle property is currently set; otherwise, it returns False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GroupByBox.ShowBandLabels
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the style of the type of band levels shown in the GroupByBox.

remarks.p: This property is used to specify the way in which band labels are rendered on the client when the GroupByBox is enabled.
The All setting will display all band labels.
The None setting will not display any band labels.
The AllWithGroupByColumnsOnly setting will only display band lables for bands for which there is a GroupBy column.
The IntermediateBandsOnly setting will display labels for bands that are between the first band with a GroupBy column and the last band with a GroupBy column, including those bands.
The Default (default) setting will use the None setting with single-band views and the IntermediateBandsOnly setting for multi-band views.
Regardess of the value of this property, band labels will not be displayed unless the property is set to OutlookGroupBy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GroupByBox.Hidden
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether the box is hidden.

remarks.p: This property returns True if the GroupByBox box is currently hidden; otherwise, it returns False.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GroupByRow
member.summary: The GroupByRow object is a row that represents a grouped column. All rows in the data source that have common/equal values in the column that is grouped will be children of the GroupByRow object. The GroupByRow object contains a reference to the grouped column as well as a reference to the particular value that the child rows have in common.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow
member.summary: The UltraGridRow displays a row of data in the grid. A row typically represents the data from a single record in the attached datasource.

remarks.p: The UltraGridRow object represents a single row of data, and corresponds to a single record in the underlying recordset. Rows occupy a position in the data hierarchy of the UltraWebGrid between Cells and Bands. The UltraGridRow object is always the child of an UltraGridBand object, and its children are UltraGridCell objects.
Much of the data-binding functionality of the grid involves working with the UltraGridRow object. Whenever an UltraGridRow object is loaded by the grid, the event is fired.

UltraGridRow objects can influence the formatting of the cells they contain through the setting of the UltraGridRow's property. Rows can also be formatted independently of the cells they contain. Frequently, cells are drawn from the top of the row to the bottom and are aligned edge to edge so that they occupy the entire area of the row; the row itself is not visible because cells are always "above" the row in the grid's z-order. However it is possible to specify spacing between and around cells that lets the underlying UltraGridRow object to show through. Only then will formatting applied directly to the UltraGridRow object be visible to the end user.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.dataChanged
member.summary: Indicates whether the row's data has been edited or this is a new or deleted row and the changes did not yet committed to the database

remarks.p: This property returns value that is different from Unchanged when a row's data has changed, the row is new, or the row has been deleted, but these changes haven't yet been committed to the data source; otherwise, it returns Unchanged.

When the value of a cell is changed by user interaction this property is set to the corresponding value and the and events are generated. Note that the cell's new value is not necessarily committed to the data source at this time, since various factors can affect when the actual update occurs. Once the data source is actually updated, this property is set back to Unchanged.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.IsChild(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow)
member.summary: Specifies whether the passed-in row is the direct child of the current row.

remarks.p: You can invoke this method to determine whether ther is a single-level parent/child relationship between two rows. You supply a reference to the UltraGridRow object you want to test in relation to the object on which you invoke the method.

Note that this method tests for a direct parent/child relationship, and will not test for rows more than one level below the current row. In other words, this method will test for childhood, but not grandchildhood. To find out whether this row is descended of another row that is more than one level below it, use the method.

member.param: The UltraGridRow object being examined to determine parenthood of the row.
member.returns: True if the supplied row is the immediate child of the current row, False if the row is not the immediate child.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.IsDescendant(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow)
member.summary: Specifies whether the passed-in row is a descendant of the current row.

remarks.p: You can invoke this method to determine whether there is any parent/child relationship between two rows. You supply a reference to the UltraGridRow object you want to test in relation to the object on which you invoke the method.

Note that this method tests for a parent/child relationship across all levels of the data hierarchy, and will determine if a row is descended directly from another row or from any descnedant of that row. To find out whether this row is decended directly from another row, use the method.

member.param: The UltraGridRow object being examined to determine ancestorhood of the current row.
member.returns: True if the supplied row is an ancestor of the current row at any level, False if the row is not an ancestor.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.NextSiblingParent
member.summary: Returns the next row available. If the next sibling is not available it moves to the next higher level and attempts to return the next non-null sibling row until it traverses to the top of the hierarchy and there are no further sibling rows available.

member.summary: Sets the current row as the active row.

remarks.p: Only one row in the grid at a time may be the active row. The active row is the one that receives the input focus. If a row is being edited, that row is automatically the active row. However, a row may also be active without being in edit mode.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.ExpandAncestors
member.summary: Expands all ancestor rows of the current row.

remarks.p: Use this method to insure that all ancestor rows of the current row will be expanded and visible to the end user.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Delete
member.summary: Deletes the current row.

remarks.p: This method will delete a row from the grid. It will also delete the corresponding record from the recordsource, provided deletion is an allowed action and the control has been properly configured to implement record deletion.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the row to the sorted data in the band and returns the row's position within the sort order.

remarks.p: This method takes into account the columns being used to sort the current band, and compares the corresponding values in the current row to those of other rows in the band.

member.returns: A long integer value representing the row's position within the sort order of the band/

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.IsSelectable
member.summary: Determines whether the row may be selected, based on the current selection settings of the grid and the band.

remarks.p: This property indicates whether the row can be selected by the end user. This method takes into account the selection strategies in effect in teh grid, but is not based on current selection status.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.IsAlternate
member.summary: Determines whether the row is an alternate (even-numbered) row.

remarks.p: The UltraWebGrid provides a number of formatting options designed to increase data readability, and one of these is the ability to apply distinct formatting to odd and even numbered rows. By formatting alternating rows with different colors and/or attributes, it is easier for the user to see what data constitutes a row and keep the data in the rows separated. This is especially true when the rows of a band are set up to use multiple levels, so that each row of data may appear, for example, three cells high on screen.
Use this method to determine whether the current row is an alternate row. Alternate rowscan have a different style from non-alternate rows by assigning style attibutes via the property.

member.returns: True if the row is alternate (even-numbered), False if the row is not alternate (odd-numbered).

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.IsActiveRow
member.summary: Determines whether the row is the active row.

remarks.p: Only one row in the grid at a time may be the active row. The active row is the one that receives the input focus. If a row is being edited, that row is automatically the active row. However, a row may also be active without being in edit mode.
Use this method to determine whether a row is currently the active row.

member.returns: True if the row is the active row, False otherwise.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.IsExpanded
member.summary: Determines whether the row is currently expanded.

remarks.p: If a row is expanded, any child row it has are visible in the grid.

member.returns: True if the row is expanded, False otherwise.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Key
member.summary: Returns or sets a unique string identifier for this Row within the UltraGridRows collection.

remarks.p: This is the key used within the UltraWebGrid's collection object model to programmatically locate grid row objects. It is different from the primary key that may uniquely identify the underlying data row within the data source, which is stored in the property. For one reason, Key is always a string whereas DataKey is an object whose underlying datatype can vary based on the data schema.)

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Activated
member.summary: Indicates whether this row has been activated.

remarks.p: A row that has been activated becomes the active row. There can only be one active row in the grid that can be accessed through the ActiveRow property.

A row can become active by the end user clicking on a cell in the row, by the end user clicking on the row area itself, or by the end user clicking on the row's row selector. The active row can also be set programmatically in an event handler.
When a row becomes the active row, or the active row changes, the event occurs.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Band
member.summary: Returns the UltraGridBand object of the band that contains the row.

remarks.p: The Band property of an object refers to a specific band in the grid as defined by an UltraGridBand object. Developers use the Band property to access the properties of a specified UltraGridBand object, or to return a reference to the UltraGridBand object that is associated with the current object.

UltraGridBand objects are the foundation of the hierarchical data structure used by UltraWebGrid. Bands are also used to apply consistent formatting and behavior to the rows that they comprise. An UltraGridBand object is used to display all the data rows from a single level of a data hierarchy. UltraGridBand objects contain multiple sets of child UltraGridRow objects that actually display the data of the recordset.

The rows of a band are generally displayed in groups of one more. How rows appear grouped depends on their relationship to the rows of the previous (parent) band and to any child rows which are in the following (child) band. For example, if a hierarchical recordset has tables that display Customer, Order and Order Detail data, each one of these record sets maps to its own band in the UltraWebGrid. The rows in the Customer band will appear separated by any Order data rows that exist for the customers. By the same token, rows in the Order band will be separated to make room for Order Detail rows.

Although the rows in a band may appear to be separated, they are treated contiguously. When selecting a column in a band, you will see that the cells of that column become selected in all rows for the band, regardless of any intervening rows. Also, it is possible to collapse the hierarchical display such that any children of the rows in the current band are hidden.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Cells
member.summary: Returns a collection of the UltraGridCell objects that make up the row.

remarks.p: This property returns a reference to a collection of UltraGridCell objects that can be used to access the UltraGridCell objects that belong to a row. Developers can use this reference to access any of the returned collection's properties or methods, as well as the properties or methods of the objects within the collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Height
member.summary: The height of the row, in pixels.

remarks.p: The height returned by this property excludes any spacing that may appear between rows.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.HeightResolved
member.summary: The height of the row, in pixels. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the row.

remarks.p: Row height is controlled by the property. However, Height may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the RowHeightDefault property of the UltraGridLayout object. RowHeightDefault may also be set to its "use default" value, which means the value used for row height is the preset one built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out the row height used in the current band, use the HeightResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you the actual height in pixels of the row.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.RowSelectorStyle
member.summary: An object that contains the style properties for the row selector.

remarks.p: Use this property to provide a custom style for the row selector. Common style attributes that can be adjusted include: forecolor, backcolor, font, and alignment. You can use different styles to provide a consistent look throughout your application, enhance the appearance of certain areas of the grid, or to call attention to important data.

Row selectors appear to the left of row data in the grid. By clicking on a row selector, the end user can activate and select a specific row. Use this property to determine how the row selector for the row will be formatted. The setting of this property may be inherited from the band level.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Hidden
member.summary: Determines whether the object will be displayed.

remarks.p: The Hidden property determines whether an object is visible. Hiding an object may have have effects that go beyond simply removing it from view. For example, hiding a band also hides all the rows in that band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Selected
member.summary: Determines the selected state of the row.

remarks.p: If the row has been selected by the end user, this property returns True. Otherwise, it returns False.

There are different ways for the end user to select a row, the most common being to click on the row selector for that row. Once a row is selected it is added to the collection, so any row that returns True for this property will be a member of that collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Sizing
member.summary: Determines whether the row height can be changed.
member.p: If row sizing is permitted, users can resize rows by clicking on the line that separates row selectors and dragging up or down.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.SizingResolved
member.summary: Determines whether the row height can be changed. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the row.

remarks.p: Row sizing is controlled by the property. However, if a band is a child of another band, AllowColSizing may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the parent band. If the parent band is a child of another band, it may also be inheriting a value for this property, so its own AllowColSizing property would also be set to the "use default" setting. Even if the band is a top-level band, AllowColSizing may be set to its "use default" value, which means the value used is the preset one built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out whether rows can be resized in the current band, use the SizingResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you whether row sizing is allowed for the band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.ParentRow
member.summary: Gets the row immediately above the current one in the data hierarchy, if any.

remarks.p: Rows in the top-level band (Band 0) will not have a parent row. For any other bands, each row is descended from a row in the previous band. This is the row returned by this property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Level
member.summary: Returns the number of the band containing the row within the grid's data hierarchy. This property is read-only.

remarks.p: You can use the Level property to determine the level of the data hierarchy (i.e. band) where the row appears.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.ParentCollection
member.summary: Returns the Rows collection that contains the current row. You can use this collection to enumerate the siblings of the current row.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Rows
member.summary: Returns the collection of the current row's child rows, if any.
member.p: You can use this property to access all the child UltraGridRow objects of the current row.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.HasChildRows
member.summary: Determines whether the row has a set of child rows.

remarks.p: If the row is a parent row with a set of child rows, this property will return True. If False, the row has no children in the next band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Tag
member.summary: A field for storing user-defined, object-related information.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Expanded
member.summary: Returns the expanded state of the row.

remarks.p: This property returns True if the row is expanded, False if it is collapsed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.DataSourceIndex
member.summary: Specifies the index (position) in the recordsource of the data record that corresponds to the current row.

remarks.p: This property is obsolete. Do not use it in your projects. This information is returned by the data binding mechanism. Depending on how data binding is being implemented, this property may not return a useful value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Style
member.summary: An object that contains the style properties for the row.

remarks.p: Use this property to provide a custom style for the row. Common style attributes that can be adjusted include: forecolor, backcolor, font, and alignment. You can use different styles to provide a consistent look throughout your application, enhance the appearance of certain areas of the grid, or to call attention to important data.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.DataKey
member.summary: Returns the key value for the underlying data row.

remarks.p: The value returned by this property is the unique identifier for the record in the datasource that correpsonds to this grid row. This may be the value of one of the fields in the database that is being used as the primary key in the recordsource, or it may be a value that is not displayed as a cell in the row because that column is hidden.

When searching for a grid row object within the grid's collection of rows, methods like FromKey use the property and not DataKey. These key values are intended for different purposes and can be (and typically are) different. Developers should recognize this distinction, and apply the DataKey property in situations when they are working in terms of data rows (as opposed to using Key with grid rows.)

summary.p: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether a Row object is displayed with an expand image next to it, regardless of whether or not it has children. This property is only effective in conjunction with the use of the LoadOnDemand property of the DisplayLayout object.

remarks.p: Set this property to true if LoadOnDemand is set to Manual and you want to indicate that the node can be expanded even though it doesn't have any child nodes.
When the user then clicks the expandsion indicator, the DemandLoad event will be fired on the server, providing the application with the opportunity to load the row with children.

member.summary: Gets a dictionary of state information (StateBag) that allows you to save and restore the view state of a server control across multiple requests for the same page.

remarks.p: A server control's view state is the accumulation of all its property values. In order to preserve these values across HTTP requests, ASP.NET server controls use this property, which is an instance of the StateBag class, to store the property values. The values are then passed as a variable to an HTML hidden input element when subsequent requests are processed. For more information about saving server control view state, see Maintaining State in a Control.

member.summary: Concludes the export processing.

An export operation may be cancelled prematurely by passing a True value in the TerminateExport of the processRowParams argument to . In this case, EndExport is called with a True value in its cancelled parameter.

This is an override from UITypeEditor. The editor style indicates what type of editor we are providing: we can either display a dialog or a drop-down box. Our editor always shows a drop-down box.
This is an override from UITypeEditor and indicates if we support painting a small representation of our value in the property grid.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager
member.summary:
The Pager class is responsible for controlling the paging behavior and appearance within the UltraWebGrid. There are three types of paging supported: 1. Built-in paging, Standard paging, and Custom paging.
Built-in paging is completely automatic and does not require any coding to implement. Built-in paging is automatically enabled when the DisplayLayout.EnableInternalRowsManagement property is set to true. With this style of paging, however, there is a large ViewState requirement, as all pages of the query must be available to the grid without the need for a call to DataBind().
Standard paging simply requires that the application responds to the PageIndexChanged event to set the new page number and call DataBind(). UltraWebGrid indexes into the DataSource and finds the correct starting point and loads the grid with the PageSize number of rows. With Custom paging, it is the application's responsibility to provide a DataSource that has the exact set of rows to be displayed. UltraWebGrid will start at the beginning of the DataSource and load the PageSize number of rows. In this scenario, the DataSource query has to be adjusted to return the correct set of rows, based upon the PageIndex or some other criteria.

The value of this property determines the default value of the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.CurrentPageIndex
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the current data page displayed by the grid.

remarks.p: When paging is enabled, this property specifies the page of data currently being displayed.
When paging is not enabled for the grid, this property always returns, and can only be set to, 1.
Paging can be enabled by setting the property to True.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.PageCount
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the total number of data pages that exist when paging is enabled. Setting of the value makes sense only if you use custom paging. In the regular mode the property is set automatically.

remarks.p: The default value this property the total number of records divided by the value of the property, rounded to the nearest integer.
When paging is not enabled for the grid, this property always returns 1.
Paging can be enabled by setting the property to True.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.AllowCustomPaging
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether custom paging is allowed.

remarks.p: True if the grid allows custom paging; otherwise, False (default).
Paging enables the grid to display data as multiple pages shown individually, rather than simply one long page. Custom paging can be used to improve performance over automatic paging.

When custom paging is enabled, it is the application developer's responsibility to provide a DataSource that has the exact set of rows to be displayed. The grid element starts at the beginning of the DataSource and loads the number of rows specified by the property. In this scenario, the DataSource query has to be adjusted to return the correct set of rows, based upon the and properties (or other criteria).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.AllowPaging
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether paging is allowed.

remarks.p: True if the grid allows paging; otherwise, False (default).
Paging enables the grid to display data as multiple pages, rather than simply one page at a time.
When paging is enabled, the number of the current data pages is displayed (see ).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.StyleMode
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the type of user interface to render on the client.

remarks.p: When paging is not enabled for the grid, this property is ignored. Developers can be enable paging by setting the property to True.

The Numeric (default) setting renders the page selection panel as a list of page numbers, beginning with 1 and ending with the value of the property, each as a hyperlink. In grid applications with a large number of pages where the page selection list wraps across multiple lines of the page selection pane, developers are encouraged to select an alternate setting to avoid overwhelming the end user.

The PrevNext setting renders the current page number and total number of pages, with customizable text hyperlinks ( and ) to move to adjacent page. This setting may be best for grid applications in which the end user should be confined to move between pages in a linearly sequence.

The CustomLabels setting uses the text labels specified by instead of the page numbers as the rendered links for different pages. This allows the developer to associate letters or names meaningful to the end user with the pages.

The ComboBox setting displays the page numbers within a drop-down combo box (a simple HTML <select>) that end users can choose their next page from. Use of this setting may be preferred when random-access is required (cf, Numeric) but the width of the grid in the browser is narrow and a long list of page numbers is undesirable.

The QuickPages setting lists a reduced number of page numbers ahead of and behind the currently-viewed page (it offers a middle-ground between Numeric's random access and PrevNext's constraint, and allows for further fine-tuning through the property).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.PagerAppearance
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies where the Pager selection pane is rendered.

remarks.p: The Top setting renders the page selection pane above the grid on the client.
The Bottom (default) setting renders the page selection pane below the grid on the client.
The Both setting renders the page selection pane identically both above and below the grid on the client.

When an end user clicks on a page link in the pager where PagerAppearance is Both, the specific instance of the page selection pane (whether it was the top or bottom pane) is indistinguishable on the server.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.Alignment
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the horizontal alignment of the text displayed when paging is enabled.

remarks.p: The Left setting horizontally aligns the text within the pager at the left.
The Center setting horizontally aligns the text centrally within the pager.
The Right (default) setting horizontally aligns the text within the pager at the right.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.PrevText
member.summary: Returns or sets the text that is displayed in the "Previous Page" link when the grid allows paging.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is "Prev".
The text that is displayed for the "Next Page" link is specified by the property.
The "Previous Page" link will not be shown unless the property is set to True and the property is set to PrevNext.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.NextText
member.summary: Returns or sets the text that is displayed in the "Next Page" link when the grid allows paging.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is "Next".
The text that is displayed for the "Previous Page" link is specified by the property.
The "Next Page" link will not be shown unless the property is set to True and the property is set to PrevNext.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.CustomLabels
member.summary: Returns or sets a list of strings that determine the text to be displayed in lieu of page indices when paging is enabled.

remarks.p: This property is ignored unless the property is set to True, and the property is set to CustomLabels.

When this property is set, the corresponding text label is displayed instead of the page's numeric index. Developers could use this property if, for example, their UltraWebGrid application were listing pages based on the characters of the alphabet.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.ChangeLinksColor
member.summary: Allows designers to apply the pager foreground color to the page links.

remarks.p: If set to true, the ForeColor of the pager's Style is applied to the page hyperlinks. Designers may wish to do this if they want the page links to match that of other foreground text appearing within the page selection list.

By default, the links' color are inherited from the <body> settings for it's ALINK and VLINK (visited) attributes, or if unspecified on the <body> it will be based on the browser's default settings for these colors (which may be customized or overriden by the end user).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.QuickPages
member.summary: Number of quick pages accessible in both directions.

remarks.p: If the property is set to QuickPages then this property controls how many pages are accessible from the current page in any direction (backwards or forwards). For example, if the property is set to 2, then up to 4 more pages are accessible from the current one: the two following pages and two preceding pages. If the current page is the first/last page (or there are fewer than the specified number of pages left in that direction), then no (or fewer) page numbers may be displayed in that direction.
This property is ignored when StyleMode indicates any other setting than QuickPages.

member.summary: Interface permitting implementations of plug-in interfaces to be created.

remarks.p: Plug-in providers must implement this in one of their components and supply it to an through that Consumer's AddFactory method. It is important that the plug-in implementation remove itself

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.IPlugInFactory.CreateExternalRenderer
member.summary: Creates a concrete implementation of the interface that can be used to insert HTML into that rendered by UltraWebGrid at specific points.
member.returns: An implementation of .

remarks.p: This method is called by the UltraWebGrid when it is about to generate HTML at extensible points during its rendering. These extensibility points are defined by the enumeration.

After the rendering is complete, whether or not the renderer returned from this factory method is used, if it implements IDisposable then its Dispose method is called to clean-up any resources it may require.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.IPlugInRender
member.summary: An interface that defines the services an external plug-in must provide to UltraWebGrid to inject customized HTML into the rendering.

remarks.p: Developers that want to inject custom HTML at one of the extensibility points defined by the enumeration must implement this interface and and then register their factory object with an such as UltraWebGrid.

Developers who wish confirmation that their IPlugInRender implementation has been called but not used (because does not match the current rendering point), or that have resource-intensive implementations, are advised to additionally implement for end-of-life notification and clean-up.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.IPlugInRender.Render(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Renders custom HTML content at the current in UltraWebGrid.
member.param: An HtmlTextWriter drain into which custom content shall be rendered by this method.
member.returns: Guidance the consumer that is True if subsequent rendering plug-ins should be called, false otherwise (some implementations are at liberty to disregard this advice).

remarks.p: This method will only be invoked on a plug-in renderer when its desired matchs the current extensibility point within UltraWebGrid's rendering process.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.IPlugInRender.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disposes of any resources retained by the current implementation.
member.param: Indicates this IPlugInRender was skipped.

remarks.p: This method is always invoked after an IPlugInRender implementation has been created. If the method was skipped because does not match the current rendering point within UltraWebGrid, the skipped parameter will be true.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.IPlugInRender.Location
member.summary: Point in UltraWebGrid's rendering at which this HTML is to be injected.

remarks.p: If the location at which this IPlugInRender implementation is offering its services does not match the location at which UltraWebGrid is presently rendering, then the method will not be called.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.RowsCollection
member.summary: The Rows Collection manages a set of UltraGridRow objects which are the child rows of an individual Row.

remarks.p: The UltraGridRow objects in a Rows Collection make up a data island. The top-level Rows of a grid are all part of a single data island.

If the grid is hierarchical, then one or more top-level UltraGridRow objects will have its own Rows Collection, which contains one or more Row objects. This creates a tree structure of parent rows and child rows that is used to display hierarchical data.

member.summary: The public constructor for a RowsCollection

member.summary: Returns an enumerator object for the Rows collection.

member.summary: Key string indexer for the collection. Uses key string to return a row.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.RowsCollection.Add(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds an UltraGridRow object to the collection with control over column template instantiation and cell initialization.
member.param: The UltraGridRow object to be added.
Indicates whether the column templates should be instantiated.
If true the new row's collection of cells will be initialized with empty cells.

remarks.p: The new is added to the collection.
The cells contained by row will be initialized with empty cells.

If the web application has already specified cell values of the correct data types, withCells can be False to prevent reinitialization of those cells. An application developer may pass skip cell initialization, if for example, the web application has already specified its own set of default values for the cells that may (for application-specific reasons) differ from the default value normally assigned by each .
Developers may suppress the instantiation of column templates at this point by passing False to the proceedTemplates parameter.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.RowsCollection.Add(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds an UltraGridRow object to the collection with control over column template instantiation.
member.param: The UltraGridRow object to be added.
Indicates whether the column templates should be instantiated.

remarks.p: The new is added to the collection. Its cells are initialized with empty cells. Developers may suppress the instantiation of column templates at this point by passing\ False to the proceedTemplates parameter.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.RowsCollection.Add(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow)
member.summary: Adds an UltraGridRow object to the collection.
member.param: The UltraGridRow object to be added.

remarks.p: The new is added to the collection. Its cells are initialized with empty cells. Any column templates are then instantiated.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.RowsCollection.Add
member.summary: Creates and adds an UltraGridRow object to the collection.

remarks.p: A new is created and then added to this . Its cells are initialized with empty cells. Any column templates are then instantiated.

Calling this method has no effect if this RowsCollection is already a non-empty Group By collection. Group By creates its own row collections based on the grouping functionality. It is inadvisable to manually alter a Group By row collection's membership.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.RowsCollection.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Creates and adds an UltraGridRow object to the collection using the key value provided.
member.param: The key value to use for the newly created row.

remarks.p: A new is created and then added to this . The Key property of the new row is given the value specified by the developer through the key parameter. The cells of the new row are then initialized with empty cells. Any column templates are then instantiated.

Calling this method has no effect if this RowsCollection is already a non-empty Group By collection. Group By creates its own row collections based on the grouping functionality. It is inadvisable to manually alter a Group By row collection's membership.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.RowsCollection.Insert(System.Int32,Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inserts an UltraGridRow object into the collection at the specified index.
member.param: The position in the collection for the new row. Note that if you specify the index of an existing row, the new row will be inserted before the existing one in the collection.
The UltraGridRow object to be inserted into the collection.
Indicates whether the column templates should be instantiated.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.RowsCollection.Insert(System.Int32,Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow)
member.summary: Inserts an UltraGridRow object into the collection at the specified index.
member.param: The position in the collection for the new row. Note that if you specify the index of an existing row, the new row will be inserted before the existing one in the collection.
The UltraGridRow object to be inserted into the collection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.RowsCollection.Remove(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow)
member.summary: Removes the specified UltraGridRow object from the collection.
member.param: The UltraGridRow object to be removed from the collection.

remarks.p: Developers can use this method to remove a row from a rows collection. If this row was formerly the selected or active row (or it contained a selected or active cell) then the selection/activation is cancelled prior to the row being removed.

Any child rows of the row to be removed are disconnected from it and also removed. If an application needs to move a row from one rows collection to another with all child rows intact, then it should simply add the row to the new parent rows collection (it will be detached from this rows collection by its new parent rows collection's Add method).

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.RowsCollection.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the UltraGridRow object at the specified index from the collection.
member.param: The index of the UltraGridRow object to be removed.

remarks.p: Developers can use RemoveAt when they know the zero-based index of the row they wish to remove. If an object reference to the row to be removed is available then can be used instead.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.RowsCollection.Clear
member.summary: Removes all of the UltraGridRow objects from the collection.

remarks.p: Calling this method is equivalent to calling on each row within this rows collection. After clearing the collection, it will contain zero rows.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.RowsCollection.Clear(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes all of the UltraGridRow objects from the collection.
member.param: When true is passed it clears the changes history as well. Should be used when a large data source is bound to reduce the size of the view state.

remarks.p: Calling this method is equivalent to calling on each row within this rows collection. After clearing the collection, it will contain zero rows.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.RowsCollection.GetNextRowDepthFirst(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow)
member.summary: This method returns the next UltraGridRow within the grid's overall hierarchical structure.
member.param: An UltraGridRow object for which the next row in the grid should be returned.
member.returns: An UltraGridRow object that corresponds to the row appearing immediately following ndSearch in the overall data hierarchy, or null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET) if ndSearch is the last row of the grid.

remarks.p: This method is useful for navigating the structure of the grid as it appears when all rows are expanded. Developers can find out which row occurs immediately after a specific row (appearing immediately beneath it on the screen) by passing the row's object to this method.

If the specified row has child rows, the first one is returned. Otherwise, if the row has a next sibling, that sibling is returned. Otherwise, the parent chain is searched to see if the row's parent has a next sibling.

member.exception: Thrown when ndSearch is supplied as null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET).

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.RowsCollection.GetPreviousRowDepthFirst(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow)
member.summary: This method returns the previous UltraGridRow within the grid's overall hierarchical structure.
member.param: An UltraGridRow object for which the next row in the grid should be returned.
member.returns: An UltraGridRow object that corresponds to the row immediately preceeding pdSearch in the overall data hierarchy, or null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET) if pdSearch is the first row of the grid.

remarks.p: This method is useful for navigating the structure of the grid as it appears when all rows are expanded. Developers can find out which row occurs immediately before a specific row (appearing immediately above it on the screen) by passing the row's object to this method.
If the specified row has preceeding siblings, the next predecessor is returned. Otherwise, if the row has a parent, that parent is returned.

member.exception: Thrown when pdSearch is supplied as null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET).

member.returns: The sorted Rows collection.

remarks.p: Adding an UltraGridRow object to this collection will cause that row to become selected in the grid. Depending on the type of selection that is allowed, this may cause other rows to become unselected.

member.param: The position in the collection for the new row. Note that if you specify the index of an existing row, the new row will be inserted before the existing one in the collection.
The UltraGridRow object to be inserted into the collection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.SelectedRowsCollection.Remove(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow)
member.summary: Removes the specified UltraGridRow object from the collection.

remarks.p: Removing an UltraGridRow object from this collection will de-select the corresponding row in the grid.

member.param: The UltraGridRow object to be removed from the collection.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.SortedColsCollection
member.summary: The collection of UltraGridColumn objects that are being used to sort the data in the band.

remarks.p: You can sort data in a Band on a column-by-column basis by choosing the columns you want to use as sort criteria and sorting them. As you choose a column to sort on, its UltraGridColumn object is added to the SortedCols collection. You can use this collection to determine which columns that are being used to sort the Band and to access the UltraGridColumn objects for those columns as needed.
