member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that is displayed to the left of the button.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is "Add..."
If the AddNewBox button is hidden, the text specified by this property is not visible.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.GroupByBoxPrompt
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that indicates to the user how to perform GroupBy operations.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is "Drag a column header here to group by that column."
The prompt will not be shown unless the property is set to OutlookGroupBy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.GroupByRowDescriptionMaskDefault
member.summary: A string that determines what text is shown in GroupBy rows. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual bands.
member.remarks: The GroupByRowDescriptionMaskDefault property can include special substitution strings that will be replaced with information from the grid. For example, you can use them to specify child row count of a GroupBy row. By default, the [caption], [value], and [count] substitution strings are set. The column header text gets placed into the [caption] field, the common cell value gets placed into the [value] field, and the number of rows sharing the common value is placed into the [count] field.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.NoDataMessage
member.summary: A string value that specifies the message that should be displayed when the grid contains no data.

remarks.p: The default message is "No Data To Display".

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.NullTextDefault
member.summary: Specifies how null values will be represented in the grid. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: This property spcifies a string value that will be displayed in a grid cell whenever a null value is received for that cell from the back end. The default setting is to use an empty string (""). However, you can specify any string you want, such as the words "null" or "empty".

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.PagerNextText
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that is displayed in the "Next Page" link when the grid allows paging.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is "Next".
The text that is displayed for the "Previous Page" link is specified by the property.
The "Next Page" link will not be shown unless the property is set to True and the property is set to PrevNext.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.PagerPrevText
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that is displayed in the "Previous Page" link when the grid allows paging.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is "Prev".
The text that is displayed for the "Next Page" link is specified by the property.
The "Previous Page" link will not be shown unless the property is set to True and the property is set to PrevNext.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.DownLevelEditColumnHeader
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that is displayed in the header of the edit column when editing is allowed in the down level grid.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is "Edit Column".
The text that is displayed in the header of the edit column. To see that column it is necessary to turn on the down level rendering for the grid and allow its editing .

member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that is displayed in the header of the delete column when deletion is allowed in the down level grid.

member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that is displayed in the edit column cells when editing is allowed in the down level grid.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is "Edit".
The text that is displayed in the edit column cells. To see that column it is necessary to turn on the down level rendering for the grid and allow its editing .

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.DownLevelUpdatePrompt
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that is displayed in the edit column cells when editing is allowed and the grid is in the edit mode in the down level rendering.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is "Update".
The text that is displayed in the edit column cells. To see that column it is necessary to turn on the down level rendering for the grid and allow its editing .
The text appears after an user has clicked on the edit link before. The link with the text is used to update changed information on the server.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.DownLevelCancelPrompt
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that is displayed in the edit column cells when editing is allowed and the grid is in the edit mode in the down level rendering.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is "Cancel".
The text that is displayed in the edit column cells. To see that column it is necessary to turn on the down level rendering for the grid and allow its editing .
The text appears after an user has clicked on the edit link before. The link with the text is used to cancel any changes in the edited row and go off the edit mode.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.DownLevelDeletePrompt
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that is displayed in the delete column cells when deletion is allowed in the down level grid.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is "Delete".
The text that is displayed in the delete column cells. To see that column it is necessary to turn on the down level rendering for the grid and allow deletion .
The link with the text is used to delete the row it's in.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.ViewState
member.summary: Gets a dictionary of state information (StateBag) that allows you to save and restore the view state of a server control across multiple requests for the same page.

remarks.p: A server control's view state is the accumulation of all its property values. In order to preserve these values across HTTP requests, ASP.NET server controls use this property, which is an instance of the StateBag class, to store the property values. The values are then passed as a variable to an HTML hidden input element when subsequent requests are processed. For more information about saving server control view state, see Maintaining State in a Control.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.XmlHTTPResponse
member.summary: XmlHTTPResponse The XmlHTTpResponse object is designed to be a feedback mechanism for the WebGrid to allow for information to be passed from the server to the client object. It is designed to allow the developer to set values that will passed down to the client and accessed during the client side XmlHTTPResponse event. This object is only designed to be used with XML rendering with XML LoadOnDemand.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid
member.summary: UltraWebGrid is the top-level object for the control. It provides access to the major functional areas of the control. The DisplayLayout property of UltraWebGrid contains many of the objects used to define behavior and appearance characteristics for the control. The Rows collection property allows access to the top level set of rows of the grid. If there are multiple levels, or Bands, for the grid, each of the top-level rows will allow access to any child rows that may be contained. For basic single level grids, UltraWebGrid exposes the Columns collection and the Rows collection for simple programmable access.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.PerformGroupRows
member.summary: Sorts all rows and creates the Group-By hierarchy when changes to the rows collection are made.

remarks.p: This method must be called from the application if there are any changes relating to the Grouping-By, Sorting, Adding or Deleting of rows made.

If one or more columns have been marked IsGroupByColumn and those columns have column footers containing calculated values, then this method must be called before accessing the results of those calculations. In calling this method, the calculation engine is refreshed for the new topology exhibited by the UltraWebGrid, and the affected footers are marked dirty and can be recalculated. Undefined behavior occurs when accessing formula results after changing the IsGroupByColumn of one or more columns, and before calling PerformGroupRows.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to programmatically generate the DemandLoad event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
This method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
When overriding DemandLoad in a derived class, be sure to call the base class' OnDemandLoad method so that registered delegates receive the event.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.Infragistics#WebUI#CalcEngine#IUltraCalcParticipant#RecreateReference
member.summary: Recreates the UltraCalc references rooted beneath the UltraWebGrid.

remarks.p: This method only needs to be called at design-time when the name of the has changed, thereby affecting the absolute names of any subordinate IUltraCalcReference implementations it may contain.
Application developers should never need to call this method at run-time.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.Infragistics#WebUI#CalcEngine#IUltraCalcParticipant#GetDesignerReferences(Infragistics.WebUI.CalcEngine.IFormulaProvider)
member.summary: Gets references needed at design-time by the Formula Builder.
member.param: A reference to an UltraCalc formula provider, which is an interface any object that wants to expose a Formula property must implement.
member.value: Returns a ReferenceNode that's the hierarchical tree of grid objects that should appear in the Formula Builder.

remarks.p: Inheritors with subclasses that provide new IFormulaProvider objects that need to be exposed to the Formula Builder at design-time should override this method (making sure to call the this base class' implementation) and insert their own ReferenceNode instances that correspond to their formula-bearing objects at the appropriate junctures within the tree.
The Formula Builder can only be used with an when there is an instance of UltraWebCalcManager also on the Page at design-time.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.Browser
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines how the control is rendered to the client.

remarks.p: The Auto (default) setting has the control determine the best way to render itself, based on the browser's capabilities.
The DownLevel setting has the control render itself using HTML 3.2.
The Uplevel setting has the control render itself using HTML 4.0 and DHTML.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.BackColor
member.summary: Returns or sets a Color object that specifies the background color of the control.

remarks.p: When this property is set, other objects in the grid may use the value of this property as the default value of their corresponding property.
The property specifies the foreground color of the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.BorderColor
member.summary: Returns or sets a Color object that specifies the color of the control's borders.

remarks.p: When this property is set, other objects in the grid may use the value of this property as the default value of their corresponding property.
The property specifies the style of the borders.
If the BorderStyle property is not set, this property is ignored.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.BorderStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets a BorderStyle object that specifies the style of the control's borders.

remarks.p: When this property is set, other objects in the grid may use the value of this property as the default value of their corresponding property.
The property specifies the color of the borders.
The property specifies the width of the borders.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.BorderWidth
member.summary: Returns or sets a Unit object that specifies the width of the control's borders.

remarks.p: When this property is set, other objects in the grid may use the value of this property as the default value of their corresponding property.
The property specifies the style of the borders.
If the BorderStyle property is not set, this property is ignored.
The property specifies the color of the borders.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.ForeColor
member.summary: Returns or sets a Color object that specifies the foreground color of the control.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is 0.
The property specifies the background color of the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.CellPadding
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the amount of space between cell borders and cell values.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is 0.
When this property is set, other objects in the grid may use the value of this property as the default value of their corresponding property.
The property specifies the amount of space between each cell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.CellSpacing
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the amount of space between each cell.

remarks.p: When this property is set, other objects in the grid may use the value of this property as the default value of their corresponding property.
The property specifies the amount of space between each cell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.HorizontalAlign
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the horizontal alignment of the text displayed by the grid.

remarks.p: The Center setting centers text horizontally.
The Justify setting spreads text uniformly so that it is aligned with both the left and right margins.
The Left setting horizontally aligns text at the left margin.
The NotSet (default) setting indicates that horizonal alignment has not been set.
The Right setting horiztonally aligns text at the right margin.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.GridLines
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies which cell borders should be displayed for the grid.

remarks.p: When this property is set, other objects in the grid may use the value of this property as the default value of their corresponding property.
The None setting does not display borders for the cells of the grid.
The Horizontal setting displays only horizontal borders for the cells.
The Vertical setting displays only vertical borders for the cells.
The Both (default) setting displays both horizontal and vertical borders for the cells.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.UpdateRow
member.summary: Manages delegates of the type . Raised after a row in the grid has been updated and focus is moved to a different row, or another control.

remarks.p: Occurs when a rows' cell values are updated. Called by .
In a grid that is not using Xml LoadOnDemand, the web application developer may wish to use the event instead of UpdateRow, for batch update processing.
If this event is handled on the server, then it will cause a PostBack to occur every time a row is edited on the client.
Note that if LoadOnDemand is set to Xml, UpdateRow is raised out-of-band.
If UpdateRow is handled on the server, all intermediate events (UpdateCell and AddRow) are postponed until the event has been raised and handled.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.UpdateRowBatch
member.summary: Event raised when a postback has occurred after rows have been updated.

remarks.p: Unlike the event, handling the UpdateRowBatch event does not immediately trigger a PostBack when a row has been updated on the client. This event will only be raised when a PostBack has been initiated from client-side code, or from a user action which causes PostBack, such as a button click.

summary.p: Occurs when a Row expand button has been clicked and its children need to be populated.

remarks.p: This event is generated when a row expansion indicator is clicked by user interaction.
This event will only be fired if the LoadOnDemand property of the WebGrid is set to LoadOnDeman.Manual.
A row can be expanded programmatically by setting the Expanded property to true, but the event is not fired in this case.
Now would be a good time to set a HeaderTemplate, FooterTemplate or CellTemplate property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.Infragistics#WebUI#UltraWebGrid#IResolveStyles#Context
member.summary: Contextual information for the Style Resolver.

remarks.p: This property is normally set to give the Style Resolver hints that it can use when resolving styles. UltraWebGrid exposes this property for informational purposes only. HTML rendering is unaffected by changes made to the Context property.
This property implements the interface.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.CalcManager
member.summary: Gets or sets the UltraWebCalcManager used for evaluating formulas in the grid.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.Infragistics#WebUI#CalcEngine#IUltraCalcParticipant#RootReference
member.summary: Gets the root IUltraCalcReference implementation for this participant in the UltraCalc network.

remarks.p: All other IUltraCalcReference implementations that this participant exposes are nested (or contained) beneath this root reference. The first reference tuple (token) in the absolute name of all references contained by this participant must be the ElementName of this root reference.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.Infragistics#WebUI#CalcEngine#IUltraCalcParticipant#SuppressCalcSettings
member.summary: Indicates whether this participant wishes to be extended by a default IUltraCalcReference implementation provided by the UltraWebCalcManager.

remarks.p: Since the provides it's own complex IUltraCalcReference implementation, it does not need the default implementation accessible through the calculation settings of it's .

Inheritors of the UltraWebGrid must override this property in their subclass in order to suppress the association of a calculation settings object (and corresponding default IUltraCalcReference implementation) with their subclassed grid.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ValidatorItem.ViewState
member.summary: Gets a dictionary of state information (StateBag) that allows you to save and restore the view state of a server control across multiple requests for the same page.

remarks.p: A server control's view state is the accumulation of all its property values. In order to preserve these values across HTTP requests, ASP.NET server controls use this property, which is an instance of the StateBag class, to store the property values. The values are then passed as a variable to an HTML hidden input element when subsequent requests are processed. For more information about saving server control view state, see Maintaining State in a Control.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ValueList
member.summary: The ValueList object maintains a list of values that the user can choose from when entering data. The ValueList is the common mechanism used to populate simple dropdown lists.
member.remarks: The ValueList object maintains a collection of items that can be displayed as the contents of a dropdown selection box. The user can click on a dropdown list in their browser and select the data supplied by the ValueList, which will appear in the grid. ValueList objects are associated with a particular column in the grid by using the ValueList property of the Column object. Each cell of the column will display the value list when placed into edit mode. ValueList objects display one value as text to the user while storing another value in the datasource.

member.summary: Returns a reference to a collection that contains a collection of objects.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ValueList.DataSource
member.summary: Returns or sets the data source that populates the items of the object.

remarks.p: This property is used to specify a source of data to populate a ValueList.
Use the property to specify the field in the data source specified by this property.
The and properties are used to specify the fields in the data source that will be used to populate the list.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ValueList.DataMember
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the record set of the data source used to populate the object.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the record set in the data source specified by the property to populate a ValueList.

The and properties are used to specify the fields in the record set that will be used to populate the list. DisplayMember specifies the value that will be displayed to the user, ValueMember specifies the value that will be stored in the datasource.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ValueList.DisplayMember
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the field of the table in the data source that will provide the item text for a object.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the field of the table in the data source specified by the and properties.
The field specified will provide the item text for a ValueList. The field providing item values is specified by the property.

This property, in conjunction with the ValueMember property, provides a way to store one value in the data source while displaying another. In this manner, the user can be presented with a list of states, for example, and if he or she selects "New York," the value "NY" could be stored in the data source. In this example, "New York" is the value of the field specified by the DisplayMember property while "NY" is the value of the field specified by the ValueMember property.
The property is used to determine whether the DisplayMember or ValueMember value is shown in the ValueList.
The default value for this property is an empty string.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ValueList.DisplayStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies whether DisplayText or DataValue of the ValueListItem objects are shown in the .

remarks.p: The DisplayText and DataValue properties of ValueListItems provide a way to store one value in the data source while displaying another. In this manner, the user can be presented with a list of states, for example, and if he or she selects "New York," the value "NY" could be stored in the data source. In this example, "New York" is the value of the field specified by the DisplayText property while "NY" is the value of the field specified by the DataValue property.
The DisplayText (default) setting specifies that DisplayText property of ValueListItems will be used.
The DataValue setting specifies that the values shown in the ValueList are provided by the ValueMember property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ValueList.ValueMember
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the field of the table in the data source that will provide the item values for a object.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the field of the table in the data source specified by the and properties.
The field specified will provide the item values for a ValueList. The field providing item text is specified by the property.

This property, in conjunction with the DisplayMember property, provides a way to store one value in the data source while displaying another. In this manner, the user can be presented with a list of states, for example, and if he or she selects "New York," the value "NY" could be stored in the data source. In this example, "New York" is the value of the field specified by the DisplayMember property while "NY" is the value of the field specified by the ValueMember property.
The property is used to determine whether the DisplayMember or ValueMember value is shown in the ValueList.
The default value for this property is an empty string.
